" --append-system-prompt "You are an AI issue solver. You prefer to find the root cause of each and every issue. When you talk, you prefer to speak with facts which you have double-checked yourself or cite sources that provide evidence, like quote actual code or give references to documents or pages found on the internet. You are polite and patient, and prefer to assume good intent, trying your best to be helpful. If you are unsure or have assumptions, you prefer to test them yourself or ask questions to clarify requirements.
General guidelines.
   - When you execute commands, always save their logs to files for easier reading if the output becomes large.
   - When running commands, do not set a timeout yourself ‚Äî let them run as long as needed (default timeout - 2 minutes is more than enough), and once they finish, review the logs in the file.
   - When running sudo commands (especially package installations like apt-get, yum, npm install, etc.), always run them in the background to avoid timeout issues and permission errors when the process needs to be killed. Use the run_in_background parameter or append & to the command.
   - When CI is failing or user reports failures, consider adding a detailed investigation protocol to your todo list with these steps:
      Step 1: List recent runs with timestamps using: gh run list --repo Jhon-Crow/godot-topdown-MVP --branch issue-721-05c2ae3f2e15 --limit 5 --json databaseId,conclusion,createdAt,headSha
      Step 2: Verify runs are after the latest commit by checking timestamps and SHA
      Step 3: For each non-passing run, download logs to preserve them: gh run view {run-id} --repo Jhon-Crow/godot-topdown-MVP --log > ci-logs/{workflow}-{run-id}.log
      Step 4: Read each downloaded log file using Read tool to understand the actual failures
      Step 5: Report findings with specific errors and line numbers from logs
      This detailed investigation is especially helpful when user mentions CI failures, asks to investigate logs, you see non-passing status, or when finalizing a PR.
      Note: If user says \"failing\" but tools show \"passing\", this might indicate stale data - consider downloading fresh logs and checking timestamps to resolve the discrepancy.
   - When a code or log file has more than 1500 lines, read it in chunks of 1500 lines.
   - When facing a complex problem, do as much tracing as possible and turn on all verbose modes.
   - When you create debug, test, or example/experiment scripts for fixing, always keep them in an ./examples and/or ./experiments folders so you can reuse them later.
   - When testing your assumptions, use the experiment scripts, and add it to ./experiments folder.
   - When your experiments can show real world use case of the software, add it to ./examples folder.
   - When you face something extremely hard, use divide and conquer ‚Äî it always helps.

Initial research.
   - When you start, make sure you create detailed plan for yourself and follow your todo list step by step, make sure that as many points from these guidelines are added to your todo list to keep track of everything that can help you solve the issue with highest possible quality.
   - When user mentions CI failures or asks to investigate logs, consider adding these todos to track the investigation: (1) List recent CI runs with timestamps, (2) Download logs from failed runs to ci-logs/ directory, (3) Analyze error messages and identify root cause, (4) Implement fix, (5) Verify fix resolves the specific errors found in logs.
   - When you read issue, read all details and comments thoroughly.
   - When you see screenshots or images in issue descriptions, pull request descriptions, comments, or discussions, use WebFetch tool (or fetch tool) to download the image first, then use Read tool to view and analyze it. IMPORTANT: Before reading downloaded images with the Read tool, verify the file is a valid image (not HTML). Use a CLI tool like 'file' command to check the actual file format. Reading corrupted or non-image files (like GitHub's HTML 404 pages saved as .png) can cause \"Could not process image\" errors and may crash the AI solver process. If the file command shows \"HTML\" or \"text\", the download failed and you should retry or skip the image.
   - When you need issue details, use gh issue view https://github.com/Jhon-Crow/godot-topdown-MVP/issues/721.
   - When you need related code, use gh search code --owner Jhon-Crow [keywords].
   - When you need repo context, read files in your working directory.
   - When you study related work, study the most recent related pull requests.
   - When issue is not defined enough, write a comment to ask clarifying questions.
   - When accessing GitHub Gists (especially private ones), use gh gist view command instead of direct URL fetching to ensure proper authentication.
   - When you are fixing a bug, please make sure you first find the actual root cause, do as many experiments as needed.
   - When you are fixing a bug and code does not have enough tracing/logs, add them and make sure they stay in the code, but are switched off by default.
   - When you need comments on a pull request, note that GitHub has THREE different comment types with different API endpoints:
      1. PR review comments (inline code comments): gh api repos/Jhon-Crow/godot-topdown-MVP/pulls/732/comments --paginate
      2. PR conversation comments (general discussion): gh api repos/Jhon-Crow/godot-topdown-MVP/issues/732/comments --paginate
      3. PR reviews (approve/request changes): gh api repos/Jhon-Crow/godot-topdown-MVP/pulls/732/reviews --paginate
      IMPORTANT: The command \"gh pr view --json comments\" ONLY returns conversation comments and misses review comments!
   - When you need latest comments on issue, use gh api repos/Jhon-Crow/godot-topdown-MVP/issues/721/comments --paginate.

Solution development and testing.
   - When issue is solvable, implement code with tests.
   - When implementing features, search for similar existing implementations in the codebase and use them as examples instead of implementing everything from scratch.
   - When coding, each atomic step that can be useful by itself should be commited to the pull request's branch, meaning if work will be interrupted by any reason parts of solution will still be kept intact and safe in pull request.
   - When you test:
      start from testing of small functions using separate scripts;
      write unit tests with mocks for easy and quick start.
   - When you test integrations, use existing framework.
   - When you test solution draft, include automated checks in pr.
   - When issue is unclear, write comment on issue asking questions.
   - When you encounter any problems that you unable to solve yourself (any human feedback or help), write a comment to the pull request asking for help.
   - When you need human help, use gh pr comment 732 --body \"your message\" to comment on existing PR.

Preparing pull request.
   - When you code, follow contributing guidelines.
   - When you commit, write clear message.
   - When you need examples of style, use gh pr list --repo Jhon-Crow/godot-topdown-MVP --state merged --search [keywords].
   - When you open pr, describe solution draft and include tests.
   - When there is a package with version and GitHub Actions workflows for automatic release, update the version (or other necessary release trigger) in your pull request to prepare for next release.
   - When you update existing pr 732, use gh pr edit to modify title and description.
   - When you are about to commit or push code, ALWAYS run local CI checks first if they are available in contributing guidelines (like ruff check, mypy, eslint, etc.) to catch errors before pushing.
   - When you finalize the pull request:
      follow style from merged prs for code, title, and description,
      make sure no uncommitted changes corresponding to the original requirements are left behind,
      make sure the default branch is merged to the pull request's branch,
      make sure all CI checks passing if they exist before you finish,
      check for latest comments on the issue and pull request to ensure no recent feedback was missed,
      double-check that all changes in the pull request answer to original requirements of the issue,
      make sure no new new bugs are introduced in pull request by carefully reading gh pr diff,
      make sure no previously existing features were removed without an explicit request from users via the issue description, issue comments, and/or pull request comments.
   - When you finish implementation, use gh pr ready 732.

Workflow and collaboration.
   - When you check branch, verify with git branch --show-current.
   - When you push, push only to branch issue-721-05c2ae3f2e15.
   - When you finish, create a pull request from branch issue-721-05c2ae3f2e15. (Note: PR 732 already exists, update it instead)
   - When you organize workflow, use pull requests instead of direct merges to default branch (main or master).
   - When you manage commits, preserve commit history for later analysis.
   - When you contribute, keep repository history forward-moving with regular commits, pushes, and reverts if needed.
   - When you face conflict that you cannot resolve yourself, ask for help.
   - When you collaborate, respect branch protections by working only on issue-721-05c2ae3f2e15.
   - When you mention result, include pull request url or comment url.
   - When you need to create pr, remember pr 732 already exists for this branch.

Self review.
   - When you check your solution draft, run all tests locally.
   - When you check your solution draft, verify git status shows a clean working tree with no uncommitted changes.
   - When you compare with repo style, use gh pr diff [number].
   - When you finalize, confirm code, tests, and description are consistent.

GitHub CLI command patterns.
   - IMPORTANT: Always use --paginate flag when fetching lists from GitHub API to ensure all results are returned (GitHub returns max 30 per page by default).
   - When listing PR review comments (inline code comments), use gh api repos/OWNER/REPO/pulls/NUMBER/comments --paginate.
   - When listing PR conversation comments, use gh api repos/OWNER/REPO/issues/NUMBER/comments --paginate.
   - When listing PR reviews, use gh api repos/OWNER/REPO/pulls/NUMBER/reviews --paginate.
   - When listing issue comments, use gh api repos/OWNER/REPO/issues/NUMBER/comments --paginate.
   - When adding PR comment, use gh pr comment NUMBER --body \"text\" --repo OWNER/REPO.
   - When adding issue comment, use gh issue comment NUMBER --body \"text\" --repo OWNER/REPO.
   - When viewing PR details, use gh pr view NUMBER --repo OWNER/REPO.
   - When filtering with jq, use gh api repos/\${owner}/\${repo}/pulls/\${prNumber}/comments --paginate --jq 'reverse | .[0:5]'.

Playwright MCP usage (browser automation via mcp__playwright__* tools).
   - When you develop frontend web applications (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Vue, Angular, etc.), use Playwright MCP tools to test the UI in a real browser.
   - When WebFetch tool fails to retrieve expected content (e.g., returns empty content, JavaScript-rendered pages, or login-protected pages), use Playwright MCP tools (browser_navigate, browser_snapshot) as a fallback for web browsing.
   - When you need to interact with dynamic web pages that require JavaScript execution, use Playwright MCP tools.
   - When you need to visually verify how a web page looks or take screenshots, use browser_take_screenshot from Playwright MCP.
   - When you need to fill forms, click buttons, or perform user interactions on web pages, use Playwright MCP tools (browser_click, browser_type, browser_fill_form).
   - When you need to test responsive design or different viewport sizes, use browser_resize from Playwright MCP.
   - When you finish using the browser, always close it with browser_close to free resources.

Visual UI work and screenshots.
   - When you work on visual UI changes (frontend, CSS, HTML, design), include a render or screenshot of the final result in the pull request description.
   - When you need to show visual results, take a screenshot and save it to the repository (e.g., in a docs/screenshots/ or assets/ folder).
   - When you save screenshots to the repository, use permanent raw file links in the pull request description markdown (e.g., https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Jhon-Crow/godot-topdown-MVP/issue-721-05c2ae3f2e15/docs/screenshots/result.png).
   - When uploading images, commit them to the branch first, then reference them using the raw GitHub URL format.
   - When the visual result is important for review, mention it explicitly in the pull request description with the embedded image." | jq -c .)

395‚Üí\t\t_shot_count = 0\n   396‚Üí\n   397‚Üí\t# Update simple reload timer and animation phases\n   398‚Üí\tif _is_reloading_simple:\n   399‚Üí\t\t_reload_timer += delta\n   400‚Üí\t\t# Progress through animation phases based on reload progress\n   401‚Üí\t\t# Divide reload_time into thirds for each phase\n   402‚Üí\t\tvar phase_duration := reload_time / 3.0\n   403‚Üí\t\tif _reload_timer < phase_duration:\n   404‚Üí\t\t\t# Phase 1: Grab magazine (already started)\n   405‚Üí\t\t\tpass\n   406‚Üí\t\telif _reload_timer < phase_duration * 2.0:\n   407‚Üí\t\t\t# Phase 2: Insert magazine\n   408‚Üí\t\t\tif _reload_anim_phase == ReloadAnimPhase.GRAB_MAGAZINE:\n   409‚Üí\t\t\t\t_start_reload_anim_phase(ReloadAnimPhase.INSERT_MAGAZINE, phase_duration)\n   410‚Üí\t\telif _reload_timer < reload_time:\n   411‚Üí\t\t\t# Phase 3: Pull bolt\n   412‚Üí\t\t\tif _reload_anim_phase == ReloadAnimPhase.INSERT_MAGAZINE:\n   413‚Üí\t\t\t\t_start_reload_anim_phase(ReloadAnimPhase.PULL_BOLT, phase_duration)\n   414‚Üí\t\telse:\n   415‚Üí\t\t\t# Complete reload\n   416‚Üí\t\t\t_complete_simple_reload()\n   417‚Üí\n   418‚Üí\t# Handle grenade input first (so it can consume shoot input)\n   419‚Üí\t_handle_grenade_input()\n   420‚Üí\n   421‚Üí\t# Make active grenade follow player if held\n   422‚Üí\tif _active_grenade != null and is_instance_valid(_active_grenade):\n   423‚Üí\t\t_active_grenade.global_position = global_position\n   424‚Üí\n   425‚Üí\t# Handle shooting input (only if not in grenade preparation state)\n   426‚Üí\t# Grenade steps 2 and 3 use LMB, so don't shoot during those\n   427‚Üí\t# In simple mode, we only use RMB so shooting with LMB is always allowed\n   428‚Üí\tvar can_shoot := _grenade_state == GrenadeState.IDLE or _grenade_state == GrenadeState.TIMER_STARTED or _grenade_state == GrenadeState.SIMPLE_AIMING\n   429‚Üí\tif can_shoot and Input.is_action_just_pressed(\"shoot\"):\n   430‚Üí\t\t_shoot()\n   431‚Üí\n   432‚Üí\t# Handle reload input based on weapon type and mode\n   433‚Üí\tif _current_weapon_type == WeaponType.REVOLVER:\n   434‚Üí\t\t_handle_revolver_reload_input()\n   435‚Üí\telif reload_mode == 0:  # Simple mode\n   436‚Üí\t\t_handle_simple_reload_input()\n   437‚Üí\telse:  # Sequence mode\n   438‚Üí\t\t_handle_sequence_reload_input()\n   439‚Üí\n   440‚Üí\t# Handle flashlight input (hold Space to turn on, release to turn off)\n   441‚Üí\t_handle_flashlight_input()\n   442‚Üí\n   443‚Üí\t# Handle homing bullets input (press Space to activate, timer-based deactivation)\n   444‚Üí\t_handle_homing_input(delta)\n   445‚Üí\n   446‚Üí\t# Handle invisibility suit input (press Space to activate) (Issue #673)\n   447‚Üí\t_handle_invisibility_suit_input()\n   448‚Üí\n   449‚Üí\n   450‚Üífunc _get_input_direction() -> Vector2:\n   451‚Üí\tvar direction := Vector2.ZERO\n   452‚Üí\tdirection.x = Input.get_axis(\"move_left\", \"move_right\")\n   453‚Üí\tdirection.y = Input.get_axis(\"move_up\", \"move_down\")\n   454‚Üí\n   455‚Üí\t# Normalize to prevent faster diagonal movement\n   456‚Üí\tif direction.length() > 1.0:\n   457‚Üí\t\tdirection = direction.normalized()\n   458‚Üí\n   459‚Üí\treturn direction\n   460‚Üí\n   461‚Üí\n   462‚Üí## Updates the player model rotation to face the aim direction.\n   463‚Üí## The player model (body, head, arms) rotates to follow the rifle's aim direction.\n   464‚Üí## This creates the appearance of the player rotating their whole body toward the target.\n   465‚Üífunc _update_player_model_rotation() -> void:\n   466‚Üí\tif not _player_model:\n   467‚Üí\t\treturn\n   468‚Üí\n   469‚Üí\t# Calculate direction to mouse cursor\n   470‚Üí\tvar mouse_pos := get_global_mouse_position()\n   471‚Üí\tvar to_mouse := mouse_pos - global_position\n   472‚Üí\n   473‚Üí\tif to_mouse.length_squared() < 0.001:\n   474‚Üí\t\treturn  # No valid direction\n   475‚Üí\n   476‚Üí\tvar aim_direction := to_mouse.normalized()\n   477‚Üí\n   478‚Üí\t# Calculate target rotation angle\n   479‚Üí\tvar target_angle := aim_direction.angle()\n   480‚Üí\n   481‚Üí\t# Handle sprite flipping for left/right aim\n   482‚Üí\t# When aiming left (angle > 90¬∞ or < -90¬∞), flip vertically to avoid upside-down appearance\n   483‚Üí\tvar aiming_left := absf(target_angle) > PI / 2\n   484‚Üí\n   485‚Üí\t# Apply rotation to the player model using GLOBAL rotation.\n   486‚Üí\t# IMPORTANT: We use global_rotation instead of (local) rotation because the Player\n   487‚Üí\t# CharacterBody2D node may also have its own rotation (e.g., during grenade throws).\n   488‚Üí\t# Using global_rotation ensures the PlayerModel's visual direction is set in world\n   489‚Üí\t# coordinates, independent of any parent rotation.\n   490‚Üí\t#\n   491‚Üí\t# When we flip the model vertically (negative scale.y), we must NEGATE the rotation\n   492‚Üí\t# angle to compensate. This is because a negative Y scale mirrors the coordinate\n   493‚Üí\t# system, which inverts the effect of rotation.\n   494‚Üí\tif aiming_left:\n   495‚Üí\t\t_player_model.global_rotation = -target_angle\n   496‚Üí\t\t_player_model.scale = Vector2(player_model_scale, -player_model_scale)\n   497‚Üí\telse:\n   498‚Üí\t\t_player_model.global_rotation = target_angle\n   499‚Üí\t\t_player_model.scale = Vector2(player_model_scale, player_model_scale)\n   500‚Üí\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.\n</system-reminder>\n"
      }

      "content": "extends CharacterBody2D\n## Player character controller for top-down movement and shooting.\n##\n## Uses physics-based movement with acceleration and friction for smooth control.\n## Supports WASD and arrow key input via configured input actions.\n## Shoots bullets towards the mouse cursor on left mouse button click.\n## Features limited ammunition system with progressive spread.\n## Includes health system for taking damage from enemy projectiles.\n\n## Maximum movement speed in pixels per second.\n@export var max_speed: float = 300.0\n\n## Acceleration rate - how quickly the player reaches max speed.\n@export var acceleration: float = 1200.0\n\n## Friction rate - how quickly the player slows down when not moving.\n@export var friction: float = 1000.0\n\n## Bullet scene to instantiate when shooting.\n@export var bullet_scene: PackedScene\n\n## Offset from player center for bullet spawn position.\n@export var bullet_spawn_offset: float = 20.0\n\n## Maximum ammunition (default 90 bullets = 3 magazines of 30 for Normal mode).\n## In Hard mode, this is reduced to 60 bullets (2 magazines).\n@export var max_ammo: int = 90\n\n## Maximum health of the player.\n@export var max_health: int = 5\n\n## Weapon loudness - determines how far gunshots propagate for enemy detection.\n## Set to viewport diagonal (~1469 pixels) for assault rifle by default.\n## This affects how far enemies can hear the player's gunshots.\n@export var weapon_loudness: float = 1469.0\n\n## Reload mode: simple (press R once) or sequence (R-F-R).\n@export_enum(\"Simple\", \"Sequence\") var reload_mode: int = 1  # Default to Sequence mode\n\n## Time to reload in seconds (only used in Simple mode).\n@export var reload_time: float = 1.5\n\n## Color when at full health.\n@export var full_health_color: Color = Color(0.2, 0.6, 1.0, 1.0)\n\n## Color when at low health (interpolates based on health percentage).\n@export var low_health_color: Color = Color(0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 1.0)\n\n## Color to flash when hit.\n@export var hit_flash_color: Color = Color(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 1.0)\n\n## Duration of hit flash effect in seconds.\n@export var hit_flash_duration: float = 0.1\n\n## Screen shake intensity per shot in pixels.\n## The actual shake distance per shot is calculated as: intensity / fire_rate * 10\n## Lower fire rate = larger shake per shot.\n@export var screen_shake_intensity: float = 5.0\n\n## Fire rate in shots per second (used for shake calculation).\n## Default is 10.0 to match the assault rifle.\n@export var fire_rate: float = 10.0\n\n## Minimum recovery time for screen shake at minimum spread.\n@export var screen_shake_min_recovery: float = 0.25\n\n## Maximum recovery time for screen shake at maximum spread (min 50ms).\n@export var screen_shake_max_recovery: float = 0.05\n\n## Current ammunition count.\nvar _current_ammo: int = 90\n\n## Current health of the player.\nvar walking over them).\n@onready var _casing_pusher: Area2D = $CasingPusher\n\n## Progressive spread system parameters.\n## Number of shots before spread starts increasing.\nconst SPREAD_THRESHOLD: int = degrees.\nconst MAX_SPREAD: float = 4.0\n## Time in seconds for spread to reset after stopping fire.\nconst SPREAD_RESET_TIME: float = 0.25\n## Force to apply to casings when pushed by player (Issue #392, #424).\n## Reduced by 2.5x from 50.0 to 20.0 for Issue #424.\nconst CASING_PUSH_FORCE: float = 20.0\n\n## Set of casings currently overlapping with the CasingPusher Area2D (Issue #392 Iteration 7).\n## Using signal-based tracking instead of polling get_overlapping_bodies() for reliable detection.\n## This ensures casings are detected even when approaching from narrow sides.\nvar _overlapping_casings: Array[RigidBody2D] = []\n\n## Current number of consecutive shots.\nvar _shot_count: int = 0\n## Timer since last shot.\nvar _shot_timer: float = 0.0\n\n## Reload sequence state (0 = waiting for R, 1 = waiting for F, 2 = waiting for R).\nvar _reload_sequence_step: int = 0\n\n## Whether the player is currently in reload sequence (for Sequence mode).\nvar _is_reloading_sequence: bool = false\n\n## Whether the player is currently reloading (for Simple mode).\nvar _is_reloading_simple: bool = false\n\n## Timer for simple reload progress.\nvar begun reloading.\nsignal reload_started\n\n## Signal emitted when grenade count changes.\nsignal grenade_changed(current: int, maximum: int)\n\n## Signal emitted when a grenade is thrown.\nsignal grenade_thrown\n\n## Signal emitted when homing bullets charges change.\nsignal homing_charges_changed(current: int, maximum: int)\n\n## Signal emitted when homing bullets effect activates.\nsignal homing_activated\n\n## Signal emitted when homing bullets effect deactivates.\nsignal homing_deactivated\n\n## Grenade scene to instantiate when throwing.\n@export var grenade_scene: PackedScene\n\n## (infinite grenades).\nvar _is_tutorial_level: bool = false\n\n## Whether the player is preparing to throw a grenade (G held down).\nvar _is_preparing_grenade: bool = false\n\n## Position where the grenade throw drag started.\nvar _grenade_drag_start: Vector2 = Vector2.ZERO\n\n## Whether the grenade throw drag has started.\nvar _grenade_drag_active: bool = false\n\n## Whether debug mode is enabled (F7 toggle, shows grenade trajectory).\nvar _debug_mode_enabled: bool = false\n\n## Whether invincibility mode is enabled (F6 toggle, player takes no damage).\nvar _invincibility_enabled: bool = false\n\n## Whether homing bullets active item is equipped.\nvar _homing_equipped: bool = false\n\n## Whether homing bullets effect is currently active (bullets home toward enemies).\nvar _homing_active: bool = false\n\n## Remaining homing charges (6 per battle).\nvar _homing_charges: int = 6\n\n## Maximum homing charges per battle.\nconst HOMING_MAX_CHARGES: int = 6\n\n## Duration of activation sound.\nconst HOMING_SOUND_PATH: String = \"res://assets/audio/homing_activation.wav\"\n\n## AudioStreamPlayer for homing activation sound.\nvar _homing_audio_player: AudioStreamPlayer = null\n\n\nfunc _ready() -> void:\n\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player] Initializing player...\")\n\n\t# Preload bullet scene if not set in inspector\n\tif bullet_scene == null:\n\t\tbullet_scene = preload(\"res://scenes/projectiles/Bullet.tscn\")\n\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player] Bullet scene preloaded\")\n\n\t# Get grenade scene from GrenadeManager (supports grenade type selection)\n\t# GrenadeManager handles the currently selected grenade type (Flashbang or Frag)\n\tif grenade_scene == null:\n\t\tvar grenade_manager: Node = get_node_or_null(\"/root/GrenadeManager\")\n\t\tif grenade_manager and grenade_manager.has_method(\"get_current_grenade_scene\"):\n\t\t\tgrenade_scene = grenade_manager.get_current_grenade_scene()\n\t\t\tif grenade_scene:\n\t\t\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player] Grenade scene loaded from GrenadeManager: %s\" % grenade_manager.get_grenade_name(grenade_manager.current_grenade_type))\n\t\t\telse:\n\t\t\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player] WARNING: GrenadeManager returned null grenade scene\")\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\t# Fallback to flashbang if GrenadeManager is not available\n\t\t\tvar grenade_path := \"res://scenes/projectiles/FlashbangGrenade.tscn\"\n\t\t\tif ResourceLoader.exists(grenade_path):\n\t\t\t\tgrenade_scene = load(grenade_path)\n\t\t\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player] Grenade scene loaded from fallback: %s\" % grenade_path)\n\t\t\telse:\n\t\t\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player] WARNING: Grenade scene not found at: %s\" % grenade_path)\n\telse:\n\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player] Grenade scene already set in inspector\")\n\n\t# Get max ammo from DifficultyManager based on current difficulty\n\tvar difficulty_manager: Node = get_node_or_null(\"/root/DifficultyManager\")\n\tif difficulty_manager:\n\t\tmax_ammo = difficulty_manager.get_max_ammo()\n\t\t# Connect to difficulty changes to update ammo limit mid-game\n\t\tif not difficulty_manager.difficulty_changed.is_connected(_on_difficulty_changed):\n\t\t\tdifficulty_manager.difficulty_changed.connect(_on_difficulty_changed)\n\n\t_current_ammo = max_ammo\n\t_current_health = max_health\n\t_is_alive = true\n\t_update_health_visual()\n\n\t# Detect if we're on the tutorial level\n\t# Tutorial level is: scenes/levels/csharp/TestTier.tscn with tutorial_level.gd script\n\tvar current_scene := get_tree().current_scene\n\tif current_scene != null:\n\t\tvar scene_path := current_scene.scene_file_path\n\t\t# Tutorial level is detected by:\n\t\t# 1. Scene path contains \"csharp/TestTier\" (the tutorial scene)\n\t\t# 2. OR scene uses tutorial_level.gd script\n\t\t_is_tutorial_level = scene_path.contains(\"csharp/TestTier\")\n\n\t\t# Also check if the scene script is tutorial_level.gd\n\t\tvar script = current_scene.get_script()\n\t\tif script != null:\n\t\t\tvar script_path: String = script.resource_path\n\t\t\tif script_path.contains(\"tutorial_level\"):\n\t\t\t\t_is_tutorial_level = true\n\n\t# Initialize grenade count based on level type\n\t# Tutorial: infinite grenades (max count)\n\t# Other levels: 1 grenade\n\tif _is_tutorial_level:\n\t\t_current_grenades = max_grenades\n\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player.Grenade] Tutorial level detected - infinite grenades enabled\")\n\telse:\n\t\t_current_grenades = 1\n\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player.Grenade] Normal level - starting with 1 grenade\")\n\n\t# Store base positions for walking animation\n\tif _body_sprite:\n\t\t_base_body_pos = _body_sprite.position\n\tif _head_sprite:\n\t\t_base_head_pos = _head_sprite.position\n\tif _left_arm_sprite:\n\t\t_base_left_arm_pos = _left_arm_sprite.position\n\tif _right_arm_sprite:\n\t\t_base_right_arm_pos = _right_arm_sprite.position\n\n\t# Apply scale to player model for larger appearance\n\tif _player_model:\n\t\t_player_model.scale = Vector2(player_model_scale, player_model_scale)\n\n\t# Store weapon mount base position for sling animation\n\tif _weapon_mount:\n\t\t_base_weapon_mount_pos = _weapon_mount.position\n\t\t_base_weapon_mount_rot = _weapon_mount.rotation\n\n\t# Set z-index for proper layering: head should be above weapon\n\t# The weapon has z_index = 1, so head should be 2 or higher\n\tif _head_sprite:\n\t\t_head_sprite.z_index = 3  # Head on top (above weapon)\n\tif _body_sprite:\n\t\t_body_sprite.z_index = 1  # Body same level as weapon\n\tif _left_arm_sprite:\n\t\t_left_arm_sprite.z_index = 2  # Arms between body and head\n\tif _right_arm_sprite:\n\t\t_right_arm_sprite.z_index = 2  # Arms between body and head\n\n\t# Note: Weapon pose detection is done in _process() after a few frames\n\t# to ensure level scripts have finished adding weapons to the player.\n\t# See _weapon_pose_applied and _weapon_detect_frame_count variables.\n\n\t# Connect to GameManager's debug signals (F6 invincibility, F7 debug mode)\n\t_connect_debug_mode_signal()\n\n\t# Initialize death animation component\n\t_init_death_animation()\n\n\t# Connect CasingPusher signals for reliable casing detection (Issue #392 Iteration 7)\n\t# Using body_entered/body_exited signals instead of polling get_overlapping_bodies()\n\t# This ensures casings are detected even when player approaches from narrow side\n\t_connect_casing_pusher_signals()\n\n\t# Initialize flashlight if active item manager has flashlight selected\n\t_init_flashlight()\n\n\t# Initialize homing bullets if active item manager has homing bullets selected\n\t_init_homing_bullets()\n\n\t# Initialize invisibility suit if active item manager has it selected (Issue #673)\n\t_init_invisibility_suit()\n\n\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player] Ready! Ammo: %d/%d, Grenades: %d/%d, Health: %d/%d\" % [\n\t\t_current_ammo, max_ammo,\n\t\t_current_grenades, max_grenades,\n\t\t_current_health, max_health\n\t])\n\tFileLogger.info(\"[Player.Grenade] Throwing system: VELOCITY-BASED (v2.0 - mouse velocity at release)\")\n\n\nfunc _physics_process(delta: float) -> void:\n\tif not _is_alive:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t# Detect weapon pose after waiting a few frames for level scripts to add weapons\n\tif not _weapon_pose_applied:\n\t\t_weapon_detect_frame_count += 1\n\t\tif _weapon_detect_frame_count >= WEAPON_DETECT_WAIT_FRAMES:\n\t\t\t_detect_and_apply_weapon_pose()\n\t\t\t_weapon_pose_applied = true\n\n\tvar input_direction := _get_input_direction()\n\n\tif input_direction != Vector2.ZERO:\n\t\t# Apply acceleration towards the input direction\n\t\tvelocity = velocity.move_toward(input_direction * max_speed, acceleration * delta)\n\telse:\n\t\t# Apply friction to slow down\n\t\tvelocity = velocity.move_toward(Vector2.ZERO, friction * delta)\n\n\tmove_and_slide()\n\n\t# Push any casings we're overlapping with (Issue #392)\n\t_push_casings()\n\n\t# Update player model rotation to face the aim direction (rifle direction)\n\t_update_player_model_rotation()\n\n\t# Update walking animation based on movement (only if not in grenade or reload animation)\n\tif _grenade_anim_phase == GrenadeAnimPhase.NONE and _reload_anim_phase == ReloadAnimPhase.NONE:\n\t\t_update_walk_animation(delta, input_direction)\n\n\t# Update grenade animation\n\t_update_grenade_animation(delta)\n\n\t# Update reload animation\n\t_update_reload_animation(delta)\n\n\t# Update spread reset timer\n\t_shot_timer += delta\n\tif _shot_timer >= SPREAD_RESET_TIME:\n\t\t_shot_count = 0\n\n\t# Update simple reload timer and animation phases\n\tif _is_reloading_simple:\n\t\t_reload_timer += delta\n\t\t# Progress through animation phases based on reload progress\n\t\t# Divide reload_time into thirds for each phase\n\t\tvar phase_duration := reload_time / 3.0\n\t\tif _reload_timer < phase_duration:\n\t\t\t# Phase 1: Grab magazine (already started)\n\t\t\tpass\n\t\telif _reload_timer < phase_duration * 2.0:\n\t\t\t# Phase 2: Insert magazine\n\t\t\tif _reload_anim_phase == ReloadAnimPhase.GRAB_MAGAZINE:\n\t\t\t\t_start_reload_anim_phase(ReloadAnimPhase.INSERT_MAGAZINE, phase_duration)\n\t\telif _reload_timer < reload_time:\n\t\t\t# Phase 3: Pull bolt\n\t\t\tif _reload_anim_phase == ReloadAnimPhase.INSERT_MAGAZINE:\n\t\t\t\t_start_reload_anim_phase(ReloadAnimPhase.PULL_BOLT, phase_duration)\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\t# Complete reload\n\t\t\t_complete_simple_reload()\n\n\t# Handle grenade input first (so it can consume shoot input)\n\t_handle_grenade_input()\n\n\t# Make active grenade follow player if held\n\tif _active_grenade != null and is_instance_valid(_active_grenade):\n\t\t_active_grenade.global_position = global_position\n\n\t# Handle shooting input (only if not in grenade preparation state)\n\t# Grenade steps 2 and 3 use LMB, so don't shoot during those\n\t# In simple mode, we only use RMB so shooting with LMB is always allowed\n\tvar can_shoot := _grenade_state == GrenadeState.IDLE or _grenade_state == GrenadeState.TIMER_STARTED or _grenade_state == GrenadeState.SIMPLE_AIMING\n\tif can_shoot and Input.is_action_just_pressed(\"shoot\"):\n\t\t_shoot()\n\n\t# Handle reload input based on weapon type and mode\n\tif _current_weapon_type == WeaponType.REVOLVER:\n\t\t_handle_revolver_reload_input()\n\telif reload_mode == 0:  # Simple mode\n\t\t_handle_simple_reload_input()\n\telse:  # Sequence mode\n\t\t_handle_sequence_reload_input()\n\n\t# Handle flashlight input (hold Space to turn on, release to turn off)\n\t_handle_flashlight_input()\n\n\t# Handle homing bullets input (press Space to activate, timer-based deactivation)\n\t_handle_homing_input(delta)\n\n\t# Handle invisibility suit input (press Space to activate) (Issue #673)\n\t_handle_invisibility_suit_input()\n\n\nfunc _get_input_direction() -> Vector2:\n\tvar direction := Vector2.ZERO\n\tdirection.x = Input.get_axis(\"move_left\", \"move_right\")\n\tdirection.y = Input.get_axis(\"move_up\", \"move_down\")\n\n\t# Normalize to prevent faster diagonal movement\n\tif direction.length() > 1.0:\n\t\tdirection = direction.normalized()\n\n\treturn direction\n\n\n## Updates the player model rotation to face the aim direction.\n## The player model (body, head, arms) rotates to follow the rifle's aim direction.\n## This creates the appearance of the player rotating their whole body toward the target.\nfunc _update_player_model_rotation() -> void:\n\tif not _player_model:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t# Calculate direction to mouse cursor\n\tvar mouse_pos := get_global_mouse_position()\n\tvar to_mouse := mouse_pos - global_position\n\n\tif to_mouse.length_squared() < 0.001:\n\t\treturn  # No valid direction\n\n\tvar aim_direction := to_mouse.normalized()\n\n\t# Calculate target rotation angle\n\tvar target_angle := aim_direction.angle()\n\n\t# Handle sprite flipping for left/right aim\n\t# When aiming left (angle > 90¬∞ or < -90¬∞), flip vertically to avoid upside-down appearance\n\tvar aiming_left := absf(target_angle) > PI / 2\n\n\t# Apply rotation to the player model using GLOBAL rotation.\n\t# IMPORTANT: We use global_rotation instead of (local) rotation because the Player\n\t# CharacterBody2D node may also have its own rotation (e.g., during grenade throws).\n\t# Using global_rotation ensures the PlayerModel's visual direction is set in world\n\t# coordinates, independent of any parent rotation.\n\t#\n\t# When we flip the model vertically (negative scale.y), we must NEGATE the rotation\n\t# angle to compensate. This is because a negative Y scale mirrors the coordinate\n\t# system, which inverts the effect of rotation.\n\tif aiming_left:\n\t\t_player_model.global_rotation = -target_angle\n\t\t_player_model.scale = Vector2(player_model_scale, -player_model_scale)\n\telse:\n\t\t_player_model.global_rotation = target_angle\n\t\t_player_model.scale = Vector2(player_model_scale, player_model_scale)\n",
      "numLines": 500,
      "startLine": 1,
      "totalLines": 3191
    }

============================================================================\n   300‚Üí\n   301‚Üí\n   302‚Üíclass MockTeleportChargeTracker:\n   303‚Üí\t## Maximum number of teleport charges\n   304‚Üí\tconst MAX_CHARGES: int = 6\n   305‚Üí\n   306‚Üí\t## Current number of teleport charges\n   307‚Üí\tvar charges: int = MAX_CHARGES\n   308‚Üí\n   309‚Üí\t## Signal tracking\n   310‚Üí\tvar bool:\n   316‚Üí\t\tif charges <= 0:\n   317‚Üí\t\t\treturn false\n   318‚Üí\t\tcharges -= 1\n   319‚Üí\t\tcharge_changed_count += 1\n   320‚Üí\t\tlast_charge_current = charges\n   321‚Üí\t\tlast_charge_max = MAX_CHARGES\n   322‚Üí\t\treturn true\n   323‚Üí\n   324‚Üí\t## Check if charges are available\n   325‚Üí\tfunc has_charges() -> bool:\n   326‚Üí\t\treturn charges > 0\n   327‚Üí\n   328‚Üí\n   329‚Üífunc test_teleport_starts_with_6_charges() -> void:\n   330‚Üí\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n   331‚Üí\tassert_eq(tracker.charges, 6,\n   332‚Üí\t\t\"Teleport should start with 6 charges\")\n   333‚Üí\n   334‚Üí\n   335‚Üífunc test_teleport_use_charge_decrements() -> void:\n   336‚Üí\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n   337‚Üí\tvar result := tracker.use_charge()\n   338‚Üí\tassert_true(result, \"Should successfully use charge\")\n   339‚Üí\tassert_eq(tracker.charges, 5, \"Should have 5 charges remaining\")\n   340‚Üí\n   341‚Üí\n   342‚Üífunc test_teleport_use_charge_emits_signal() -> void:\n   343‚Üí\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n   344‚Üí\ttracker.use_charge()\n   345‚Üí\tassert_eq(tracker.charge_changed_count, 1,\n   346‚Üí\t\t\"Charge change should be tracked\")\n   347‚Üí\tassert_eq(tracker.last_charge_current, 5,\n   348‚Üí\t\t\"Signal should report 5 charges remaining\")\n   349‚Üí\tassert_eq(tracker.last_charge_max, 6,\n   350‚Üí\t\t\"Signal should report 6 max charges\")\n   351‚Üí\n   352‚Üí\n   353‚Üífunc test_teleport_use_all_charges() -> void:\n   354‚Üí\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n   355‚Üí\tfor i in range(6):\n   356‚Üí\t\tvar result := tracker.use_charge()\n   357‚Üí\t\tassert_true(result, \"Charge %d should succeed\" % (i + 1))\n   358‚Üí\tassert_eq(tracker.charges, 0, \"Should have 0 charges remaining\")\n   359‚Üí\tassert_false(tracker.has_charges(), \"Should have no charges available\")\n   360‚Üí\n ============================================================================\n   393‚Üí# Armory Integration Tests (Teleport Bracers in Menu)\n   394‚Üí# ============================================================================\n   395‚Üí\n   396‚Üí\n   397‚Üíclass MockArmoryWithTeleportBracers:\n   398‚Üí\t## Active item data\n   399‚Üí\tconst ACTIVE_ITEMS: Dictionary = {\n   400‚Üí\t\t0: {\"name\": \"None\", \"description\": \"No active item equipped.\"},\n   401‚Üí\t\t1: {\"name\": \"Flashlight\", \"description\": \"Tactical flashlight\"},\n   402‚Üí\t\t2: {\"name\": \"Teleport Bracers\", \"description\": \"Teleportation bracers\"}\n   403‚Üí\t}\n   404‚Üí\n   405‚Üí\t## Applied active item type\n   406‚Üí\tvar applied_active_item: int = 0\n   407‚Üí\n   408‚Üí\t## Pending active item type\n   409‚Üí\tvar pending_active_item: int = 0\n   410‚Üí\n   411‚Üí\t## Tracking\n   412‚Üí\tvar active_item_changed_count: int = 0\n   413‚Üí\tvar apply_count: int = 0\n   414‚Üí\n   415‚Üí\t## Select an active item (sets pending, does NOT apply immediately)\n   416‚Üí\tfunc select_active_item(item_type: int) -> bool:\n   417‚Üí\t\tif item_type not in ACTIVE_ITEMS:\n   418‚Üí\t\t\treturn false\n   419‚Üí\t\tpending_active_item = item_type\n   420‚Üí\t\treturn true\n   421‚Üí\n   422‚Üí\t## Check for pending changes\n   423‚Üí\tfunc has_pending_changes() -> bool:\n   424‚Üí\t\treturn pending_active_item != applied_active_item\n   425‚Üí\n   426‚Üí\t## Apply pending changes\n   427‚Üí\tfunc apply() -> bool:\n   428‚Üí\t\tif not has_pending_changes():\n   429‚Üí\t\t\treturn false\n   430‚Üí\t\tif pending_active_item != applied_active_item:\n   431‚Üí\t\t\tactive_item_changed_count += 1\n   432‚Üí\t\tapplied_active_item = pending_active_item\n   433‚Üí\t\tapply_count += 1\n   434‚Üí\t\treturn true\n   435‚Üí\n   436‚Üí\n   437‚Üífunc test_armory_select_teleport_bracers() -> void:\n   438‚Üí\tvar armory := MockArmoryWithTeleportBracers.new()\n   439‚Üí\tvar result := armory.select_active_item(2)\n   440‚Üí\tassert_true(result, still be None\")\n   443‚Üí\n   444‚Üí\n   445‚Üífunc test_armory_apply_teleport_bracers() -> void:\n   446‚Üí\tvar armory := MockArmoryWithTeleportBracers.new()\n 475‚Üí\tassert_true(armory.select_active_item(2), \"Teleport Bracers should be selectable\")\n   476‚Üí\tassert_false(armory.select_active_item(99), \"Invalid should not be selectable\")\n   477‚Üí\n   478‚Üí\n   479‚Üí# ============================================================================\n   480‚Üí# Wall Skip Logic Tests\n   481‚Üí# ============================================================================\n   482‚Üí\n   483‚Üí\n   484‚Üíclass MockWallSkipCalculator:\n   485‚Üí\t## Simulates the wall-skipping logic for teleport targeting.\n   486‚Üí\t## In the real implementation, this uses physics raycasts.\n   487‚Üí\n   488‚Üí\t## Test walls as line segments: [[start_x, start_y, end_x, end_y], ...]\n   489‚Üí\tvar walls: Array = []\n   490‚Üí\n   491‚Üí\t## Player collision radius\n   492‚Üí\tconst PLAYER_RADIUS: float = 16.0\n   493‚Üí\n   494‚Üí\t## Check if a line segment from a to b crosses any wall\n   495‚Üí\tfunc ray_hits_wall(from: Vector2, to: Vector2) -> Dictionary:\n   496‚Üí\t\tfor wall in walls:\n   497‚Üí\t\t\tvar wall_start := Vector2(wall[0], wall[1])\n   498‚Üí\t\t\tvar wall_end := Vector2(wall[2], wall[3])\n   499‚Üí\n   500‚Üí\t\t\t# Simple line-line intersection test\n   501‚Üí\t\t\tvar intersection := _line_intersection(from, to, wall_start, wall_end)\n   502‚Üí\t\t\tif intersection[\"hit\"]:\n   503‚Üí\t\t\t\treturn intersection\n   504‚Üí\t\treturn {\"hit\": false}\n   505‚Üí\n   506‚Üí\t## Simple 2D line-line intersection\n   507‚Üí\tfunc _line_intersection(p1: Vector2, p2: Vector2, p3: Vector2, p4: Vector2) -> Dictionary:\n   508‚Üí\t\tvar d := (p1.x - p2.x) * (p3.y - p4.y) - (p1.y - p2.y) * (p3.x - p4.x)\n   509‚Üí\t\tif absf(d) < 0.001:\n   510‚Üí\t\t\treturn {\"hit\": false}\n   511‚Üí\n   512‚Üí\t\tvar t := ((p1.x - p3.x) * (p3.y - p4.y) - (p1.y - p3.y) * (p3.x - p4.x)) / d\n   513‚Üí\t\tvar u := -((p1.x - p2.x) * (p1.y - p3.y) - (p1.y - p2.y) * (p1.x - p3.x)) / d\n   514‚Üí\n   515‚Üí\t\tif t >= 0.0 and t <= 1.0 and u >= 0.0 and u <= 1.0:\n   516‚Üí\t\t\tvar point := Vector2(\n   517‚Üí\t\t\t\tp1.x + t * (p2.x - p1.x),\n   518‚Üí\t\t\t\tp1.y + t * (p2.y - p1.y)\n   519‚Üí\t\t\t)\n   520‚Üí\t\t\treturn {\"hit\": true, \"position\": point, \"t\": t}\n   521‚Üí\t\treturn {\"hit\": false}\n   522‚Üí\n   523‚Üí\n   524‚Üífunc test_no_wall_returns_cursor_position() -> void:\n   525‚Üí\tvar calc := MockWallSkipCalculator.new()\n   526‚Üí\t# No walls defined\n   527‚Üí\tvar result := calc.ray_hits_wall(Vector2(0, 0), Vector2(200, 0))\n   528‚Üí\tassert_false(result[\"hit\"],\n   529‚Üí\t\t\"Should not hit wall when no walls exist\")\n   530‚Üí\n   531‚Üí\n   532‚Üífunc test_wall_detected_between_player_and_cursor() -> void:\n   533‚Üí\tvar calc := MockWallSkipCalculator.new()\n   534‚Üí\t# Vertical wall at x=100\n   535‚Üí\tcalc.walls.append([100, -1000, 100, 1000])\n   536‚Üí\tvar result := calc.ray_hits_wall(Vector2(0, 0), Vector2(200, 0))\n   537‚Üí\tassert_true(result[\"hit\"],\n   538‚Üí\t\t\"Should detect wall between player and cursor\")\n   539‚Üí\tassert_almost_eq(result[\"position\"].x, 100.0, 1.0,\n   540‚Üí\t\t\"Wall hit should be at x=100\")\n   541‚Üí\n   542‚Üí\n   543‚Üífunc test_wall_not_hit_when_cursor_before_wall() -> void:\n   544‚Üí\tvar calc := MockWallSkipCalculator.new()\n   545‚Üí\tcalc.walls.append([100, -1000, 100, 1000])\n   546‚Üí\tvar result := calc.ray_hits_wall(Vector2(0, 0), Vector2(50, 0))\n   547‚Üí\tassert_false(result[\"hit\"],\n   548‚Üí\t\t\"Should not hit wall when cursor is before it\")\n   549‚Üí\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. Reticle skips through walls.\"\n\t\t}\n\t}\n\n\t## Signal tracking\n\tvar type_changed_count: int = 0\n\tvar last_restart_called: bool = false\n\n\t## Set the current active item type\n\tfunc set_active_item(type: int, restart_level: bool = true) -> void:\n\t\tif type == current_active_item:\n\t\t\treturn\n\n\t\tif type not in ACTIVE_ITEM_DATA:\n\t\t\treturn\n\n\t\tcurrent_active_item = type\n\t\ttype_changed_count += 1\n\n\t\tif restart_level:\n\t\t\tlast_restart_called = true\n\n\t## Get active item data for a specific type\n\tfunc get_active_item_data(type: int) -> ACTIVE_ITEM_DATA.keys()\n\n\t## Get the name of an active item type\n\tfunc get_active_item_name(type: int) -> String:\n\t\tif type in ACTIVE_ITEM_DATA:\n\t\t\treturn ============================================================================\n# Selection State Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_is_selected_after_changing_to_teleport_bracers() -> void:\n\tmanager.set_active_item(2)\n\tassert_true(manager.is_selected(2),\n\t\t\"TELEPORT_BRACERS should be selected after changing to it\")\n\tassert_false(manager.is_selected(0),\n\t\t\"NONE should not be selected after changing away from it\")\n\tassert_false(manager.is_selected(1),\n\t\t\"FLASHLIGHT should not be selected after changing away from it\")\n\n\nfunc test_switch_between_all_active_items() -> void:\n\tmanager.set_active_item(1)  # Flashlight\n\tmanager.set_active_item(2)  # Teleport Bracers\n\tmanager.set_active_item(0)  # None\n\tmanager.set_active_item(2)  # Back to Teleport Bracers\n\n\tassert_eq(manager.current_active_item, 2)\n\tassert_eq(manager.type_changed_count, 4)\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Teleport Charge Tracking Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nclass MockTeleportChargeTracker:\n\t## Maximum number of teleport charges\n\tconst MAX_CHARGES: int = 6\n\n\t## Current number of teleport charges\n\tvar charges: int = MAX_CHARGES\n\n\t## Signal tracking\n\tvar charge_changed_count: int = 0\n\tvar last_charge_current: int = 0\n\tvar last_charge_max: int = 0\n\n\t## Use a charge (teleport)\n\tfunc use_charge() -> bool:\n\t\tif charges <= 0:\n\t\t\treturn false\n\t\tcharges -= 1\n\t\tcharge_changed_count += 1\n\t\tlast_charge_current = charges\n\t\tlast_charge_max = MAX_CHARGES\n\t\treturn true\n\n\t## Check if charges are available\n\tfunc has_charges() -> bool:\n\t\treturn charges > 0\n\n\nfunc test_teleport_starts_with_6_charges() -> void:\n\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n\tassert_eq(tracker.charges, 6,\n\t\t\"Teleport should start with 6 charges\")\n\n\nfunc test_teleport_use_charge_decrements() -> void:\n\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n\tvar result := tracker.use_charge()\n\tassert_true(result, \"Should successfully use charge\")\n\tassert_eq(tracker.charges, 5, \"Should have 5 charges remaining\")\n\n\nfunc test_teleport_use_charge_emits_signal() -> void:\n\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n\ttracker.use_charge()\n\tassert_eq(tracker.charge_changed_count, 1,\n\t\t\"Charge change should be tracked\")\n\tassert_eq(tracker.last_charge_current, 5,\n\t\t\"Signal should report 5 charges remaining\")\n\tassert_eq(tracker.last_charge_max, 6,\n\t\t\"Signal should report 6 max charges\")\n\n\nfunc test_teleport_use_all_charges() -> void:\n\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n\tfor i in range(6):\n\t\tvar result := tracker.use_charge()\n\t\tassert_true(result, \"Charge %d should succeed\" % (i + 1))\n\tassert_eq(tracker.charges, 0, \"Should have 0 charges remaining\")\n\tassert_false(tracker.has_charges(), \"Should have no charges available\")\n\n\nfunc test_teleport_cannot_use_when_no_charges() -> void:\n\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n\t# Use all 6 charges\n\tfor i in range(6):\n\t\ttracker.use_charge()\n\t# Try to use 7th charge\n\tvar result := tracker.use_charge()\n\tassert_false(result, \"Should not be able to use charge when empty\")\n\tassert_eq(tracker.charges, 0, \"Charges should remain at 0\")\n\tassert_eq(tracker.charge_changed_count, 6,\n\t\t\"Should only have 6 charge changes\")\n\n\nfunc test_teleport_charges_do_not_regenerate() -> void:\n\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n\ttracker.use_charge()\n\t# Charges should stay at 5 (no regen)\n\tassert_eq(tracker.charges, 5,\n\t\t\"Charges should not regenerate\")\n\n\nfunc test_teleport_no_cooldown_between_uses() -> void:\n\tvar tracker := MockTeleportChargeTracker.new()\n\t# Use charges in rapid succession (no cooldown)\n\tfor i in range(3):\n\t\tvar result := tracker.use_charge()\n\t\tassert_true(result, \"Use %d should succeed without cooldown\" % (i + 1))\n\tassert_eq(tracker.charges, 3, \"Should have 3 charges after 3 uses\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Armory Integration Tests (Teleport Bracers in Menu)\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nclass MockArmoryWithTeleportBracers:\n\t## Active item data\n\tconst ACTIVE_ITEMS: Dictionary = {\n\t\t0: {\"name\": \"None\", \"description\": \"No active item equipped.\"},\n\t\t1: {\"name\": \"Flashlight\", \"description\": \"Tactical flashlight\"},\n\t\t2: {\"name\": \"Teleport Bracers\", \"description\": \"Teleportation bracers\"}\n\t}\n\n\t## Applied active item type\n\tvar applied_active_item: int = 0\n\n\t## Pending active item type\n\tvar pending_active_item: int = 0\n\n\t## Tracking\n\tvar active_item_changed_count: int = 0\n\tvar apply_count: int = 0\n\n\t## Select an active item (sets pending, does NOT apply immediately)\n\tfunc select_active_item(item_type: int) -> bool:\n\t\tif item_type not in ACTIVE_ITEMS:\n\t\t\treturn false\n\t\tpending_active_item = item_type\n\t\treturn true\n\n\t## Check for pending changes\n\tfunc has_pending_changes() -> bool:\n\t\treturn pending_active_item != applied_active_item\n\n\t## Apply pending changes\n\tfunc apply() -> bool:\n\t\tif not has_pending_changes():\n\t\t\treturn false\n\t\tif pending_active_item != applied_active_item:\n\t\t\tactive_item_changed_count += 1\n\t\tapplied_active_item = pending_active_item\n\t\tapply_count += 1\n\t\treturn true\n\n\nfunc test_armory_select_teleport_bracers() -> void:\n\tvar armory := MockArmoryWithTeleportBracers.new()\n\tvar result := armory.select_active_item(2)\n\tassert_true(result, \"Should select teleport bracers\")\n\tassert_eq(armory.pending_active_item, 2, \"Pending should be teleport bracers\")\n\tassert_eq(armory.applied_active_item, 0, \"Applied should still be None\")\n\n\nfunc test_armory_apply_teleport_bracers() -> void:\n\tvar armory := MockArmoryWithTeleportBracers.new()\n\tarmory.select_active_item(2)\n\tvar result := armory.apply()\n\tassert_true(result, \"Apply should succeed\")\n\tassert_eq(armory.applied_active_item, 2, \"Applied should be teleport bracers\")\n\tassert_eq(armory.active_item_changed_count, 1, \"Change count should be 1\")\n\n\nfunc test_armory_switch_flashlight_to_teleport_bracers() -> void:\n\tvar armory := MockArmoryWithTeleportBracers.new()\n\tarmory.select_active_item(1)\n\tarmory.apply()\n\tarmory.select_active_item(2)\n\tarmory.apply()\n\tassert_eq(armory.applied_active_item, 2, \"Should be teleport bracers\")\n\tassert_eq(armory.active_item_changed_count, 2, \"Should have 2 changes\")\n\n\nfunc test_armory_teleport_bracers_has_pending_changes() -> void:\n\tvar armory := MockArmoryWithTeleportBracers.new()\n\tarmory.select_active_item(2)\n\tassert_true(armory.has_pending_changes(),\n\t\t\"Should have pending changes after selecting bracers\")\n\n\nfunc test_armory_all_three_active_items_selectable() -> void:\n\tvar armory := MockArmoryWithTeleportBracers.new()\n\tassert_true(armory.select_active_item(0), \"None should be selectable\")\n\tassert_true(armory.select_active_item(1), \"Flashlight should be selectable\")\n\tassert_true(armory.select_active_item(2), \"Teleport Bracers should be selectable\")\n\tassert_false(armory.select_active_item(99), \"Invalid should not be selectable\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Wall Skip Logic Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nclass MockWallSkipCalculator:\n\t## Simulates the wall-skipping logic for teleport targeting.\n\t## In the real implementation, this uses physics raycasts.\n\n\t## Test walls as line segments: [[start_x, start_y, end_x, end_y], ...]\n\tvar walls: Array = []\n\n\t## Player collision radius\n\tconst PLAYER_RADIUS: float = 16.0\n\n\t## Check if a line segment from a to b crosses any wall\n\tfunc ray_hits_wall(from: Vector2, to: Vector2) -> Dictionary:\n\t\tfor wall in walls:\n\t\t\tvar wall_start := Vector2(wall[0], wall[1])\n\t\t\tvar wall_end := Vector2(wall[2], wall[3])\n\n\t\t\t# Simple line-line intersection test\n\t\t\tvar intersection := _line_intersection(from, to, wall_start, wall_end)\n\t\t\tif intersection[\"hit\"]:\n\t\t\t\treturn intersection\n\t\treturn {\"hit\": false}\n\n\t## Simple 2D line-line intersection\n\tfunc _line_intersection(p1: Vector2, p2: Vector2, p3: Vector2, p4: Vector2) -> Dictionary:\n\t\tvar d := (p1.x - p2.x) * (p3.y - p4.y) - (p1.y - p2.y) * (p3.x - p4.x)\n\t\tif absf(d) < 0.001:\n\t\t\treturn {\"hit\": false}\n\n\t\tvar t := ((p1.x - p3.x) * (p3.y - p4.y) - (p1.y - p3.y) * (p3.x - p4.x)) / d\n\t\tvar u := -((p1.x - p2.x) * (p1.y - p3.y) - (p1.y - p2.y) * (p1.x - p3.x)) / d\n\n\t\tif t >= 0.0 and t <= 1.0 and u >= 0.0 and u <= 1.0:\n\t\t\tvar point := Vector2(\n\t\t\t\tp1.x + t * (p2.x - p1.x),\n\t\t\t\tp1.y + t * (p2.y - p1.y)\n\t\t\t)\n\t\t\treturn {\"hit\": true, \"position\": point, \"t\": t}\n\t\treturn {\"hit\": false}\n\n\nfunc test_no_wall_returns_cursor_position() -> void:\n\tvar calc := MockWallSkipCalculator.new()\n\t# No walls defined\n\tvar result := calc.ray_hits_wall(Vector2(0, 0), Vector2(200, 0))\n\tassert_false(result[\"hit\"],\n\t\t\"Should not hit wall when no walls exist\")\n\n\nfunc test_wall_detected_between_player_and_cursor() -> void:\n\tvar calc := MockWallSkipCalculator.new()\n\t# Vertical wall at x=100\n\tcalc.walls.append([100, -1000, 100, 1000])\n\tvar result := calc.ray_hits_wall(Vector2(0, 0), Vector2(200, 0))\n\tassert_true(result[\"hit\"],\n\t\t\"Should detect wall between player and cursor\")\n\tassert_almost_eq(result[\"position\"].x, 100.0, 1.0,\n\t\t\"Wall hit should be at x=100\")\n\n\nfunc test_wall_not_hit_when_cursor_before_wall() -> void:\n\tvar calc := MockWallSkipCalculator.new()\n\tcalc.walls.append([100, -1000, 100, 1000])\n\tvar result := calc.ray_hits_wall(Vector2(0, 0), Vector2(50, 0))\n\tassert_false(result[\"hit\"],\n\t\t\"Should not hit wall when cursor is before it\")\n",

      "startLine": 1,
      "totalLines": 549
    }

shadow_enabled = true so it doesn't pass through walls,\n## matching how weapon muzzle flash works (Issue #469).\n##\n## The effect fades out over FLASH_DURATION seconds and then self-destructs.\n\n## Duration of the flashbang effect in seconds.\nconst FLASH_DURATION: float = 0.5\n\n## Starting energy (intensity) of the point light.\n## Flashbang is much brighter than muzzle flash.\nconst Whether the effect has started.\nvar _is_active: bool = false\n\n## Effect radius (used to scale the light texture).\nvar effect_radius: float = 400.0\n\n\nfunc _ready() -> void:\n\t# Get reference to 0.0\n\n\t# Set initial light energy\n\tif _point_light:\n\t\t_point_light.energy = LIGHT_START_ENERGY\n\t\t_point_light.visible = true\n\n\nfunc _process(delta: float) -> void:\n\tif not _is_active:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t_elapsed_time += delta\n\n\t# Calculate fade progress (0 to 1)\n\tvar progress := clampf(_elapsed_time / FLASH_DURATION, 0.0, 1.0)\n\n\t# Fade out the light using ease-out curve for more natural falloff\n\tif _point_light:\n\t\tvar fade := 1.0 - progress\n\t\t# Apply ease-out curve (starts fast, slows down)\n\t\tfade = fade * fade\n\t\t_point_light.energy = LIGHT_START_ENERGY * fade\n\n\t# Check if effect is complete\n\tif progress >= 1.0:\n\t\t_is_active = false\n\t\tqueue_free()\n",

89‚Üí\t_player = player\n    90‚Üí\tFileLogger.info(\"[InvisibilitySuit] Initialized with player: %s, charges: %d/%d\" % [\n    91‚Üí\t\tplayer.name, charges, MAX_CHARGES\n    92‚Üí\t])\n    93‚Üí\n    94‚Üí\n    95‚Üí## Attempt to activate the invisibility effect.\n    96‚Üí## Returns true if activation was successful.\n    97‚Üífunc activate() -> bool:\n    98‚Üí\tif is_active:\n    99‚Üí\t\treturn false  # Already active\n   100‚Üí\n   101‚Üí\tif charges <= 0:\n   102‚Üí\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[InvisibilitySuit] No charges remaining\")\n   103‚Üí\t\treturn false\n   104‚Üí\n   105‚Üí\t# Consume a charge\n   106‚Üí\tcharges -= 1\n   107‚Üí\tis_active = true\n   108‚Üí\t_effect_timer = EFFECT_DURATION\n   109‚Üí\t_is_fading_in = true\n   110‚Üí\t_is_fading_out = false\n   111‚Üí\t_current_mix = 0.0\n   112‚Üí\n   113‚Üí\t# Apply shader to all player sprites\n   114‚Üí\t_apply_shader_to_player()\n   115‚Üí\n   116‚Üí\tFileLogger.info(\"[InvisibilitySuit] Activated! 121‚Üí\tcharges_changed.emit(charges, MAX_CHARGES)\n   122‚Üí\treturn true\n   123‚Üí\n   124‚Üí\n   125‚Üí## Deactivate the invisibility effect (start fade out).\n   126‚Üífunc deactivate() -> void:\n   127‚Üí\tif not is_active:\n   128‚Üí\t\treturn\n   129‚Üí\n   130‚Üí\t_is_fading_in = false\n   131‚Üí\t_is_fading_out = true\n   132‚Üí\tFileLogger.info(\"[InvisibilitySuit] Deactivating (fade out)\")\n   133‚Üí\n   134‚Üí\n   135‚Üí## Force-stop the invisibility effect immediately (no fade).\n   136‚Üífunc force_stop() -> void:\n   137‚Üí\tis_active = false\n   138‚Üí\t_is_fading_in = false\n   139‚Üí\t_is_fading_out = false\n   140‚Üí\t_current_mix = 0.0\n   141‚Üí\t_effect_timer = 0.0\n   142‚Üí\t_remove_shader_from_player()\n   143‚Üí\tFileLogger.info(\"[InvisibilitySuit] Force stopped\")\n   144‚Üí\tinvisibility_deactivated.emit(charges)\n   145‚Üí\n   146‚Üí\n   147‚Üífunc _process(delta: float) -> void:\n   148‚Üí\tif not is_active and not _is_fading_out:\n   149‚Üí\t\treturn\n   150‚Üí\n   151‚Üí\t# Handle fade in\n   152‚Üí\tif _is_fading_in:\n   153‚Üí\t\t_current_mix = minf(_current_mix + delta / FADE_IN_TIME, 1.0)\n   154‚Üí\t\tif _current_mix >= 1.0:\n   155‚Üí\t\t\t_is_fading_in = false\n   156‚Üí\t\t_update_shader_mix()\n   157‚Üí\n   158‚Üí\t# Count down effect timer\n   159‚Üí\tif is_active:\n   160‚Üí\t\t_effect_timer -= delta\n   161‚Üí\t\tif _effect_timer <= 0.0:\n   162‚Üí\t\t\tdeactivate()\n   163‚Üí\n   164‚Üí\t# Handle fade out\n   165‚Üí\tif _is_fading_out:\n   166‚Üí\t\t_current_mix = maxf(_current_mix - delta / FADE_OUT_TIME, 0.0)\n   167‚Üí\t\t_update_shader_mix()\n   168‚Üí\t\tif _current_mix <= 0.0:\n   169‚Üí\t\t\t_is_fading_out = false\n   170‚Üí\t\t\tis_active = false\n remaining effect time in seconds.\n   182‚Üífunc get_remaining_time() -> float:\n   183‚Üí\treturn _effect_timer if is_active else 0.0\n   184‚Üí\n   185‚Üí\n   186‚Üí## Get the current number of charges.\n   187‚Üífunc get_charges() -> int:\n   188‚Üí\treturn charges\n   189‚Üí\n   190‚Üí\n   191‚Üí## Update the shader mix_amount parameter on all affected sprites.\n   192‚Üífunc _update_shader_mix() -> void:\n   193‚Üí\tfor sprite in _affected_sprites:\n   194‚Üí\t\tif is_instance_valid(sprite) and sprite.material is ShaderMaterial:\n   195‚Üí\t\t\t(sprite.material as Head, Arms, WeaponMount children)\n   213‚Üí\t_apply_shader_recursive(player_model)\n   214‚Üí\n   215‚Üí\t# Also apply shader to the weapon node (direct child of Player, not under PlayerModel)\n   216‚Üí\t# In the C# scene, weapons like MakarovPM are siblings of PlayerModel\n   217‚Üí\tvar weapon = _player.get(\"CurrentWeapon\")\n   218‚Üí\tif weapon != null and weapon is CanvasItem:\n   219‚Üí\t\t_apply_shader_recursive_include_self(weapon)\n   220‚Üí\n   221‚Üí\tFileLogger.info(\"[InvisibilitySuit] Shader applied to %d sprites\" % _affected_sprites.size())\n   222‚Üí\n   223‚Üí\n 227‚Üí\t\tif child is CanvasItem:\n   228‚Üí\t\t\t_apply_shader_to_canvas_item(child as CanvasItem)\n   229‚Üí\n   230‚Üí\t\t# Recurse into children (e.g., WeaponMount -> weapon sprites)\n The visual effect is a transparent ripple\n## (chromatic distortion) applied to all player sprites.\n##\n## Gameplay rules:\n## - 2 charges per battle (resets on level restart)\n## - Each activation lasts 4 seconds\n## - Enemies cannot see the player while invisible (vision blocked)\n## - Enemies can still hear gunshots and reload sounds (sound NOT blocked)\n\n## Duration of invisibility effect in seconds.\nconst EFFECT_DURATION: float = 4.0\n\n## Maximum charges per battle.\nconst MAX_CHARGES: int = 2\n\n## Time for the cloak to fade in (seconds).\nconst FADE_IN_TIME: float = 0.3\n\n## Time for the cloak to fade out (seconds).\nconst FADE_OUT_TIME: float = 0.5\n\n## Shader path for the invisibility cloak effect.\nconst SHADER_PATH: String = \"res://scripts/shaders/invisibility_cloak.gdshader\"\n\n## Current number of charges remaining.\nvar charges: int = MAX_CHARGES\n\n## Whether the invisibility effect is currently active.\nvar is_active: bool = false\n\n## Timer tracking remaining effect duration.\nvar _effect_timer: float = 0.0\n\n## Current fade amount (0.0 = visible, 1.0 = fully cloaked).\nvar _current_mix: float = load(SHADER_PATH)\n\t\tif _shader:\n\t\t\t_shader_material = ShaderMaterial.new()\n\t\t\t_shader_material.shader = _shader\n\t\t\t_shader_material.set_shader_parameter(\"mix_amount\", active\n\n\tif charges <= 0:\n\t\tFileLogger.info(\"[InvisibilitySuit] No charges remaining\")\n\t\treturn false\n\n\t# Consume a charge\n\tcharges -= 1\n\tis_active = true\n\t_effect_timer = true\n\tFileLogger.info(\"[InvisibilitySuit] Deactivating (fade out)\")\n\n\n## Force-stop the invisibility effect immediately (no fade).\nfunc force_stop() -> void:\n\tis_active = false\n\t_is_fading_in = false\n\t_is_fading_out = false\n\t_current_mix = 0.0\n\t_effect_timer = 0.0\n\t_remove_shader_from_player()\n\tFileLogger.info(\"[InvisibilitySuit] Force stopped\")\n\tinvisibility_deactivated.emit(charges)\n\n\nfunc _process(delta: float) -> void:\n\tif not is_active and not _is_fading_out:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t# Handle fade in\n\tif CanvasItem)\n\t_apply_shader_recursive(node)\n\n\n## Apply the cloak shader to a single CanvasItem, saving the original material.\nfunc _apply_shader_to_canvas_item(canvas_item: CanvasItem) -> enemies are eliminated.\n   361‚Üífunc _setup_exit_zone() -> void:\n   362‚Üí\t# Load and instantiate the exit zone\n   363‚Üí\tvar exit_zone_scene = load(\"res://scenes/objects/ExitZone.tscn\")\n 1.0))\n   725‚Üí\n   726‚Üí\n   727‚Üí## Update the magazines label showing individual magazine ammo counts.\n   728‚Üí## Shows format: MAGS: [30] | 25 | 10 where [30] is current magazine.\n   729‚Üí## Hidden when a shotgun (tube magazine weapon) is equipped.\n   730‚Üífunc _update_magazines_label(magazine_ammo_counts: Array) -> void:\n   731‚Üí\tif _magazines_label == null:\n   732‚Üí\t\treturn\n   733‚Üí\n   734‚Üí\t# Check if player has a weapon with tube magazine (shotgun)\n   735‚Üí\t# If so, hide the magazine label as shotguns don't use detachable magazines\n   736‚Üí\tvar weapon = null\n   737‚Üí\tif _player:\n   738‚Üí\t\tweapon = _player.get_node_or_null(\"Shotgun\")\n   739‚Üí\t\tif weapon == null:\n   740‚Üí\t\t\tweapon = _player.get_node_or_null(\"AssaultRifle\")\n   741‚Üí\t\tif weapon == null:\n   742‚Üí\t\t\tweapon = _player.get_node_or_null(\"AKGL\")\n   743‚Üí\t\tif weapon == null:\n   744‚Üí\t\t\tweapon = _player.get_node_or_null(\"MakarovPM\")\n   745‚Üí\n   746‚Üí\tif weapon != null and weapon.get(\"UsesTubeMagazine\") == true:\n   747‚Üí\t\t# Shotgun equipped - hide magazine display\n   748‚Üí\t\t_magazines_label.visible = false\n   749‚Üí\t\treturn\n   750‚Üí\telse:\n   751‚Üí\t\t_magazines_label.visible = true\n   752‚Üí\n   753‚Üí\tif magazine_ammo_counts.is_empty():\n   754‚Üí\t\t_magazines_label.text = \"MAGS: -\"\n   755‚Üí\t\treturn\n   756‚Üí\n   757‚Üí\tvar parts: Array = []\n   758‚Üí\tfor i in range(magazine_ammo_counts.size()):\n   759‚Üí\t\tvar ammo: int = magazine_ammo_counts[i]\n   760‚Üí\t\tif i == 0:\n   761‚Üí\t\t\t# Current magazine in brackets\n   762‚Üí\t\t\tparts.append(\"[%d]\" % ammo)\n   763‚Üí\t\telse:\n   764‚Üí\t\t\t# Spare magazines\n   765‚Üí\t\t\tparts.append(\"%d\" % ammo)\n   766‚Üí\n   767‚Üí\t_magazines_label.text = \"MAGS: \" + \" | \".join(parts)\n   768‚Üí\n   769‚Üí\n   770‚Üí## Update the enemy count label in UI.\n -\"\n\t_magazines_label.set_anchors_preset(Control.PRESET_TOP_LEFT)\n\t_magazines_label.offset_left = 10\n\t_magazines_label.offset_top = 105\n\t_magazines_label.offset_right = 400\n\t_magazines_label.offset_bottom = 135\n\tui.add_child(_magazines_label)\n\n\n\n## Setup saturation overlay for kill effect.\nfunc _setup_saturation_overlay() -> void:\n\tvar canvas_layer := get_node_or_null(\"CanvasLayer\")\n\tif canvas_layer == null:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t_saturation_overlay = ColorRect.new()\n\t_saturation_overlay.name = \"SaturationOverlay\"\n\t# Yellow/gold tint for saturation increase effect\n\t_saturation_overlay.color = Color(1.0, 0.9, 0.3, 0.0)\n\t_saturation_overlay.set_anchors_preset(Control.PRESET_FULL_RECT)\n\t_saturation_overlay.mouse_filter = Control.MOUSE_FILTER_IGNORE\n\t# Add to the front\n\tcanvas_layer.add_child(_saturation_overlay)\n\tcanvas_layer.move_child(_saturation_overlay, canvas_layer.get_child_count() - 1)\n\n\n## Update debug UI with current stats.\nfunc _update_debug_ui() -> void:\n\tif GameManager == null:\n\t\treturn\n\n\tif _kills_label:\n\t\t_kills_label.text = \"Kills: %d\" % GameManager.kills\n\n\tif _accuracy_label:\n\t\t_accuracy_label.text = \"Accuracy: %.1f%%\" % GameManager.get_accuracy()\n\n\n## Called when an enemy dies.\nfunc _on_enemy_died() -> void:\n\t_current_enemy_count -= 1\n\t_update_enemy_count_label()\n\n\t# Register kill with GameManager\n\tif GameManager:\n\t\tGameManager.register_kill()\n\n\tif _current_enemy_count <= 0:\n\t\tprint(\"All enemies eliminated! Arena cleared!\")\n\t\t# Stop replay recording\n\t\tvar replay_manager: Node = _get_or_create_replay_manager()\n\t\tif replay_manager and replay_manager.has_method(\"StopRecording\"):\n\t\t\treplay_manager.StopRecording()\n\t\t_level_cleared = true\n\t\t# Activate exit zone - score will show when player reaches it\n\t\tcall_deferred(\"_activate_exit_zone\")\n\n\n## Called when an enemy dies with special kill information (for score tracking).\nfunc _on_enemy_died_with_info(is_ricochet_kill: bool, is_penetration_kill: bool) -> void:\n\t# Register kill with ScoreManager including special kill info\n\tvar score_manager: Node = get_node_or_null(\"/root/ScoreManager\")\n\tif score_manager and score_manager.has_method(\"register_kill\"):\n\t\tscore_manager.register_kill(is_ricochet_kill, is_penetration_kill)\n\n\n## Called when an enemy is hit (for accuracy tracking).\nfunc _on_enemy_hit() -> void:\n\tif GameManager:\n\t\tGameManager.register_hit()\n\n\n## Called when a shot is fired (from C# weapon).\nfunc _on_shot_fired() -> void:\n\tif GameManager:\n\t\tGameManager.register_shot()\n\n\n## Called when player ammo changes (GDScript Player).\nfunc _on_player_ammo_changed(current: int, maximum: int) -> void:\n\t_update_ammo_label(current, maximum)\n\t# Register shot for accuracy tracking\n\tif GameManager:\n\t\tGameManager.register_shot()\n\n\n## Called when weapon ammo changes (C# Player).\nfunc _on_weapon_ammo_changed(current_ammo: int, reserve_ammo: int) -> void:\n\t_update_ammo_label_magazine(current_ammo, reserve_ammo)\n\t# Check if completely out of ammo\n\tif current_ammo <= 0 and reserve_ammo <= 0:\n\t\tif _current_enemy_count > 0 and not _game_over_shown:\n\t\t\t_show_game_over_message()\n\n\n## Called when magazine inventory changes (C# Player).\nfunc _on_magazines_changed(magazine_ammo_counts: Array) -> void:\n\t_update_magazines_label(magazine_ammo_counts)\n\n\n## Called when shotgun shell count changes (during shell-by-shell reload).\n## This allows the ammo counter to update immediately as each shell is loaded.\nfunc _on_shell_count_changed(shell_count: int, _capacity: int) -> void:\n\t# Get the reserve ammo from the weapon for display\n\tvar reserve_ammo: int = 0\n\tif _player:\n\t\tvar weapon = _player.get_node_or_null(\"Shotgun\")\n\t\tif weapon != null and weapon.get(\"ReserveAmmo\") != null:\n\t\t\treserve_ammo = weapon.ReserveAmmo\n\t_update_ammo_label_magazine(shell_count, reserve_ammo)\n\n\n## Called when player runs out of ammo in current magazine.\n## This notifies nearby enemies that the player tried to shoot with empty weapon.\n## Note: This does NOT show game over - the player may still have reserve ammo.\n## Game over is only shown when BOTH current AND reserve ammo are depleted\n## (handled in _on_weapon_ammo_changed for C# player, or when GDScript player\n## truly has no ammo left).\nfunc _on_player_ammo_depleted() -> void:\n\t# Notify all enemies that player tried to shoot with empty weapon\n\t_broadcast_player_ammo_empty(true)\n\t# Emit empty click sound via SoundPropagation system so enemies can hear through walls\n\t# This has shorter range than reload sound but still propagates through obstacles\n\tif _player:\n\t\tvar sound_propagation: Node = get_node_or_null(\"/root/SoundPropagation\")\n\t\tif sound_propagation and sound_propagation.has_method(\"emit_player_empty_click\"):\n\t\t\tsound_propagation.emit_player_empty_click(_player.global_position, _player)\n\n\t# For GDScript player, check if truly out of all ammo (no reserve)\n\t# For C# player, game over is handled in _on_weapon_ammo_changed\n\tif _player and _player.has_method(\"get_current_ammo\"):\n\t\t# GDScript player - max_ammo is the only ammo they have\n\t\tvar current_ammo: int = _player.get_current_ammo()\n\t\tif current_ammo <= 0 and _current_enemy_count > 0 and not _game_over_shown:\n\t\t\t_show_game_over_message()\n\t# C# player game over is handled via _on_weapon_ammo_changed signal\n\n\n## Called when player starts reloading.\n## Notifies nearby enemies that player is vulnerable via sound propagation.\n## The reload sound can be heard through walls at greater distance than line of sight.\nfunc _on_player_reload_started() -> void:\n\t_broadcast_player_reloading(true)\n\t# Emit reload sound via SoundPropagation system so enemies can hear through walls\n\tif _player:\n\t\tvar sound_propagation: Node = get_node_or_null(\"/root/SoundPropagation\")\n\t\tif sound_propagation and sound_propagation.has_method(\"emit_player_reload\"):\n\t\t\tsound_propagation.emit_player_reload(_player.global_position, _player)\n\n\n## Called when player finishes reloading.\n## Clears the reloading state for all enemies.\nfunc _on_player_reload_completed() -> void:\n\t_broadcast_player_reloading(false)\n\t# Also clear ammo empty state since player now has ammo\n\t_broadcast_player_ammo_empty(false)\n\n\n## Broadcast player reloading state to all enemies.\nfunc _broadcast_player_reloading(is_reloading: bool) -> void:\n\tvar enemies_node := get_node_or_null(\"Environment/Enemies\")\n\tif enemies_node == null:\n\t\treturn\n\n\tfor enemy in enemies_node.get_children():\n\t\tif enemy.has_method(\"set_player_reloading\"):\n\t\t\tenemy.set_player_reloading(is_reloading)\n\n\n## Broadcast player ammo empty state to all enemies.\nfunc _broadcast_player_ammo_empty(is_empty: bool) -> void:\n\tvar enemies_node := get_node_or_null(\"Environment/Enemies\")\n\tif enemies_node == null:\n\t\treturn\n\n\tfor enemy in enemies_node.get_children():\n\t\tif enemy.has_method(\"set_player_ammo_empty\"):\n\t\t\tenemy.set_player_ammo_empty(is_empty)\n\n\n## Called when player dies.\nfunc _on_player_died() -> void:\n\t_show_death_message()\n\t# Auto-restart via GameManager\n\tif GameManager:\n\t\t# Small delay to show death message\n\t\tawait get_tree().create_timer(0.5).timeout\n\t\tGameManager.on_player_death()\n\n\n## Called when GameManager signals enemy killed (for screen effect).\nfunc _on_game_manager_enemy_killed() -> void:\n\t_show_saturation_effect()\n\n\n## Shows the saturation effect when killing an enemy.\nfunc _show_saturation_effect() -> void:\n\tif _saturation_overlay == null:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t# Create a tween for the saturation effect\n\tvar tween := create_tween()\n\t# Flash in\n\ttween.tween_property(_saturation_overlay, \"color:a\", SATURATION_INTENSITY, SATURATION_DURATION * 0.3)\n\t# Flash out\n\ttween.tween_property(_saturation_overlay, \"color:a\", 0.0, SATURATION_DURATION * 0.7)\n\n\n## Update the ammo label with color coding (simple format for GDScript Player).\nfunc _update_ammo_label(current: int, maximum: int) -> void:\n\tif _ammo_label == null:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t_ammo_label.text = \"AMMO: %d/%d\" % [current, maximum]\n\n\t# Color coding: red at <=5, yellow at <=10, white otherwise\n\tif current <= 5:\n\t\t_ammo_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color(1.0, 0.2, 0.2, 1.0))\n\telif current <= 10:\n\t\t_ammo_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color(1.0, 1.0, 0.2, 1.0))\n\telse:\n\t\t_ammo_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 1.0))\n\n\n## Update the ammo label with magazine format (for C# Player with weapon).\n## Shows format: AMMO: magazine/reserve (e.g., \"AMMO: 30/60\")\nfunc _update_ammo_label_magazine(current_mag: int, reserve: int) -> void:\n\tif _ammo_label == null:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t_ammo_label.text = \"AMMO: %d/%d\" % [current_mag, reserve]\n\n\t# Color coding: red when mag <=5, yellow when mag <=10\n\tif current_mag <= 5:\n\t\t_ammo_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color(1.0, 0.2, 0.2, 1.0))\n\telif current_mag <= 10:\n\t\t_ammo_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color(1.0, 1.0, 0.2, 1.0))\n\telse:\n\t\t_ammo_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 1.0))\n\n\n## Update the magazines label showing individual magazine ammo counts.\n## Shows format: MAGS: [30] | 25 | 10 where [30] is current magazine.\n## Hidden when a shotgun (tube magazine weapon) is equipped.\nfunc _update_magazines_label(magazine_ammo_counts: Array) -> void:\n\tif _magazines_label == null:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t# Check if player has a weapon with tube magazine (shotgun)\n\t# If so, hide the magazine label as shotguns don't use detachable magazines\n\tvar weapon = null\n\tif _player:\n\t\tweapon = _player.get_node_or_null(\"Shotgun\")\n\t\tif weapon == null:\n\t\t\tweapon = _player.get_node_or_null(\"AssaultRifle\")\n\t\tif weapon == null:\n\t\t\tweapon = _player.get_node_or_null(\"AKGL\")\n\t\tif weapon == null:\n\t\t\tweapon = _player.get_node_or_null(\"MakarovPM\")\n\n\tif weapon != null and weapon.get(\"UsesTubeMagazine\") == true:\n\t\t# Shotgun equipped - hide magazine display\n\t\t_magazines_label.visible = false\n\t\treturn\n\telse:\n\t\t_magazines_label.visible = true\n\n\tif magazine_ammo_counts.is_empty():\n\t\t_magazines_label.text = \"MAGS: -\"\n\t\treturn\n\n\tvar parts: Array = []\n\tfor i in range(magazine_ammo_counts.size()):\n\t\tvar ammo: int = magazine_ammo_counts[i]\n\t\tif i == 0:\n\t\t\t# Current magazine in brackets\n\t\t\tparts.append(\"[%d]\" % ammo)\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\t# Spare magazines\n\t\t\tparts.append(\"%d\" % ammo)\n\n\t_magazines_label.text = \"MAGS: \" + \" | \".join(parts)\n\n\n## Update the enemy count label in UI.\nfunc _update_enemy_count_label() -> void:\n\tif _enemy_count_label:\n\t\t_enemy_count_label.text = \"Enemies: %d\" % _current_enemy_count\n\n\n## Complete the level and show the score screen.\nfunc _complete_level_with_score() -> void:\n\tvar score_manager: Node = get_node_or_null(\"/root/ScoreManager\")\n\tif score_manager and skip: Skip counting/rank animations (Issue #568)\n## @param score_data: Dictionary containing all score components from ScoreManager.\nfunc _show_score_screen(score_data: Dictionary) -> void:\n\tvar 28)\n\ttotal_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color(1.0, 0.9, 0.3, 1.0))\n\tcontainer.add_child(total_label)\n\n\t# Rank\n\tvar rank_label := Label.new()\n\trank_label.text = \"RANK: score_data.rank == \"S\" else Color(0.2, 1.0, 0.3, 1.0)\n\trank_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", rank_color)\n\tcontainer.add_child(rank_label)\n\n\n## Show death message when player
