        "input": {
          "file_path": "/tmp/gh-issue-solver-1770746081925/scripts/effects/teleport_effect.gd",
          "content": "extends Node2D\n## Visual teleportation effect for level transitions (Issue #721).\n##\n## Creates a sci-fi style teleportation effect with:\n## - A bottom portal ring (concentric circles)\n## - A top portal ring (descends/ascends during animation)\n## - Particle effects (sparkles, light beams)\n## - A light column between the portals\n##\n## Animation phases:\n## - DISAPPEAR: Top ring descends, player fades out (sinking into portal)\n## - APPEAR: Top ring ascends, player fades in (emerging from portal)\n##\n## Usage:\n## 1. Instantiate this scene at the player's position\n## 2. Call play_disappear() to start the disappear animation\n## 3. Connect to animation_finished signal to know when done\n## 4. Optionally call play_appear() at destination for appear effect\n\n## Signal emitted when the animation finishes (either disappear or appear).\nsignal animation_finished(animation_type: String)\n\n## Signal emitted during disappear when player should be hidden.\nsignal player_should_hide\n\n## Signal emitted during appear when player should be shown.\nsignal player_should_show\n\n## Animation phases.\nenum AnimPhase { IDLE, DISAPPEAR, APPEAR }\n\n## Current animation phase.\nvar _current_phase: AnimPhase = AnimPhase.IDLE\n\n## Duration of the teleport animation in seconds.\nconst ANIMATION_DURATION: float = 0.8\n\n## Color for the portal rings (cyan/blue sci-fi style).\nconst PORTAL_COLOR: Color = Color(0.2, 0.8, 1.0, 0.9)\n\n## Color for the light column.\nconst LIGHT_COLOR: Color = Color(0.3, 0.9, 1.0, 0.7)\n\n## Color for particles.\nconst PARTICLE_COLOR: Color = Color(0.5, 0.95, 1.0, 0.8)\n\n## Radius of the portal rings.\nconst PORTAL_RADIUS: float = 40.0\n\n## Height of the light column at maximum.\nconst COLUMN_HEIGHT: float = 80.0\n\n## Ring thickness.\nconst RING_THICKNESS: float = 3.0\n\n## Number of concentric rings.\nconst RING_COUNT: int = 3\n\n## Animation progress (0.0 to 1.0).\nvar _progress: float = 0.0\n\n## Bottom portal ring (stays at player feet).\nvar _bottom_ring: Node2D = null\n\n## Top portal ring (moves up/down during animation).\nvar _top_ring: Node2D = null\n\n## Light column between portals.\nvar _light_column: ColorRect = null\n\n## Particle emitter for sparkles.\nvar _particles: GPUParticles2D = null\n\n## Point light for glow effect.\nvar _point_light: PointLight2D = null\n\n## Reference to the target (usually player) for visibility control.\nvar _target: Node2D = null\n\n## Initial player modulate value to restore.\nvar _original_modulate: Color = Color.WHITE\n\n\nfunc _ready() -> void:\n\t# Create visual components\n\t_create_portal_rings()\n\t_create_light_column()\n\t_create_particles()\n\t_create_point_light()\n\n\t# Start hidden\n\t_set_effect_visible(false)\n\n\n## Set the target node whose visibility will be controlled during the effect.\nfunc set_target(target: Node2D) -> void:\n\t_target = target\n\tif _target:\n\t\t_original_modulate = _target.modulate\n\n\n## Play the disappear animation (player sinks into portal).\nfunc play_disappear() -> void:\n\tif _current_phase != AnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t_current_phase = AnimPhase.DISAPPEAR\n\t_progress = 0.0\n\t_set_effect_visible(true)\n\n\tFileLogger.info(\"[TeleportEffect] Playing disappear animation\")\n\n\n## Play the appear animation (player emerges from portal).\nfunc play_appear() -> void:\n\tif _current_phase != AnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t_current_phase = AnimPhase.APPEAR\n\t_progress = 0.0\n\t_set_effect_visible(true)\n\n\t# Start with target hidden for appear animation\n\tif _target and is_instance_valid(_target):\n\t\t_target.modulate = Color(_original_modulate.r, _original_modulate.g, _original_modulate.b, 0.0)\n\n\tFileLogger.info(\"[TeleportEffect] Playing appear animation\")\n\n\nfunc _process(delta: float) -> void:\n\tif _current_phase == AnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t# Update animation progress\n\t_progress += delta / ANIMATION_DURATION\n\t_progress = clampf(_progress, 0.0, 1.0)\n\n\t# Update visual elements based on progress and phase\n\t_update_animation()\n\n\t# Check if animation is complete\n\tif _progress >= 1.0:\n\t\t_complete_animation()\n\n\n## Update all visual elements based on current progress.\nfunc _update_animation() -> void:\n\tvar t: float = _progress\n\n\t# Apply easing for smooth animation\n\tvar ease_t: float = _ease_in_out(t)\n\n\tmatch _current_phase:\n\t\tAnimPhase.DISAPPEAR:\n\t\t\t_update_disappear_animation(ease_t)\n\t\tAnimPhase.APPEAR:\n\t\t\t_update_appear_animation(ease_t)\n\n\n## Update the disappear animation state.\nfunc _update_disappear_animation(t: float) -> void:\n\t# Top ring descends from COLUMN_HEIGHT to 0\n\tif _top_ring:\n\t\t_top_ring.position.y = -COLUMN_HEIGHT * (1.0 - t)\n\n\t# Light column shrinks as top ring descends\n\tif _light_column:\n\t\tvar column_height: float = COLUMN_HEIGHT * (1.0 - t)\n\t\t_light_column.size.y = column_height\n\t\t_light_column.position.y = -column_height\n\t\t# Fade out as it shrinks\n\t\t_light_column.modulate.a = (1.0 - t) * LIGHT_COLOR.a\n\n\t# Fade out target (player)\n\tif _target and is_instance_valid(_target):\n\t\tvar alpha: float = 1.0 - t\n\t\t_target.modulate = Color(_original_modulate.r, _original_modulate.g, _original_modulate.b, alpha)\n\n\t\t# Emit signal when player should be fully hidden (at 50% progress)\n\t\tif t >= 0.5 and t < 0.55:\n\t\t\tplayer_should_hide.emit()\n\n\t# Particle intensity decreases\n\tif _particles:\n\t\t_particles.amount_ratio = 1.0 - (t * 0.5)\n\n\t# Light intensity follows animation\n\tif _point_light:\n\t\t_point_light.energy = 2.0 * (1.0 - t * 0.7)\n\n\t# Ring opacity pulses\n\t_update_ring_opacity(1.0 - t * 0.3)\n\n\n## Update the appear animation state.\nfunc _update_appear_animation(t: float) -> void:\n\t# Top ring ascends from 0 to COLUMN_HEIGHT\n\tif _top_ring:\n\t\t_top_ring.position.y = -COLUMN_HEIGHT * t\n\n\t# Light column grows as top ring ascends\n\tif _light_column:\n\t\tvar column_height: float = COLUMN_HEIGHT * t\n\t\t_light_column.size.y = column_height\n\t\t_light_column.position.y = -column_height\n\t\t# Fade in as it grows, then fade out at end\n\t\tvar column_alpha: float = 0.0\n\t\tif t < 0.5:\n\t\t\tcolumn_alpha = t * 2.0\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\tcolumn_alpha = (1.0 - t) * 2.0\n\t\t_light_column.modulate.a = column_alpha * LIGHT_COLOR.a\n\n\t# Fade in target (player)\n\tif _target and is_instance_valid(_target):\n\t\tvar alpha: float = t\n\t\t_target.modulate = Color(_original_modulate.r, _original_modulate.g, _original_modulate.b, alpha)\n\n\t\t# Emit signal when player should start showing (at 50% progress)\n\t\tif t >= 0.5 and t < 0.55:\n\t\t\tplayer_should_show.emit()\n\n\t# Particle intensity peaks in middle\n\tif _particles:\n\t\tvar particle_ratio: float = 0.0\n\t\tif t < 0.5:\n\t\t\tparticle_ratio = t * 2.0\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\tparticle_ratio = (1.0 - t) * 2.0\n\t\t_particles.amount_ratio = particle_ratio\n\n\t# Light intensity follows animation\n\tif _point_light:\n\t\tvar light_energy: float = 0.0\n\t\tif t < 0.5:\n\t\t\tlight_energy = t * 4.0\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\tlight_energy = (1.0 - t) * 4.0\n\t\t_point_light.energy = light_energy\n\n\t# Ring opacity pulses\n\tvar ring_opacity: float = 0.7 + 0.3 * sin(t * PI)\n\t_update_ring_opacity(ring_opacity)\n\n\n## Update the opacity of portal rings.\nfunc _update_ring_opacity(opacity: float) -> void:\n\tif _bottom_ring:\n\t\t_bottom_ring.modulate.a = opacity\n\tif _top_ring:\n\t\t_top_ring.modulate.a = opacity\n\n\n## Complete the current animation.\nfunc _complete_animation() -> void:\n\tvar finished_phase: String = \"disappear\" if _current_phase == AnimPhase.DISAPPEAR else \"appear\"\n\n\t# Restore target visibility based on animation type\n\tif _target and is_instance_valid(_target):\n\t\tif _current_phase == AnimPhase.DISAPPEAR:\n\t\t\t_target.modulate = Color(_original_modulate.r, _original_modulate.g, _original_modulate.b, 0.0)\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\t_target.modulate = _original_modulate\n\n\t_current_phase = AnimPhase.IDLE\n\t_set_effect_visible(false)\n\n\tFileLogger.info(\"[TeleportEffect] Animation completed: %s\" % finished_phase)\n\tanimation_finished.emit(finished_phase)\n\n\n## Create the portal ring nodes.\nfunc _create_portal_rings() -> void:\n\t# Bottom ring (at feet level)\n\t_bottom_ring = _create_ring_node(\"BottomRing\")\n\t_bottom_ring.position = Vector2.ZERO\n\tadd_child(_bottom_ring)\n\n\t# Top ring (moves during animation)\n\t_top_ring = _create_ring_node(\"TopRing\")\n\t_top_ring.position = Vector2(0, -COLUMN_HEIGHT)\n\tadd_child(_top_ring)\n\n\n## Create a single ring node with concentric circles.\nfunc _create_ring_node(ring_name: String) -> Node2D:\n\tvar ring_container := Node2D.new()\n\tring_container.name = ring_name\n\n\t# Create multiple concentric rings using Line2D\n\tfor i in range(RING_COUNT):\n\t\tvar ring := Line2D.new()\n\t\tring.name = \"Ring%d\" % i\n\t\tring.width = RING_THICKNESS - i * 0.5\n\t\tring.default_color = PORTAL_COLOR\n\t\tring.default_color.a = 1.0 - (i * 0.2)\n\t\tring.joint_mode = Line2D.LINE_JOINT_ROUND\n\t\tring.end_cap_mode = Line2D.LINE_CAP_ROUND\n\t\tring.begin_cap_mode = Line2D.LINE_CAP_ROUND\n\n\t\t# Create circular points\n\t\tvar radius: float = PORTAL_RADIUS - (i * 8.0)\n\t\tvar points: PackedVector2Array = PackedVector2Array()\n\t\tvar segments: int = 32\n\t\tfor j in range(segments + 1):\n\t\t\tvar angle: float = (j / float(segments)) * TAU\n\t\t\tpoints.append(Vector2(cos(angle) * radius, sin(angle) * radius * 0.4))  # Ellipse for perspective\n\t\tring.points = points\n\n\t\tring_container.add_child(ring)\n\n\treturn ring_container\n\n\n## Create the light column between portals.\nfunc _create_light_column() -> void:\n\t_light_column = ColorRect.new()\n\t_light_column.name = \"LightColumn\"\n\t_light_column.color = LIGHT_COLOR\n\t_light_column.size = Vector2(PORTAL_RADIUS * 1.2, COLUMN_HEIGHT)\n\t_light_column.position = Vector2(-PORTAL_RADIUS * 0.6, -COLUMN_HEIGHT)\n\n\t# Add some transparency gradient effect via modulate\n\t_light_column.modulate = Color(1, 1, 1, 0.6)\n\n\tadd_child(_light_column)\n\n\n## Create particle effects for sparkles.\nfunc _create_particles() -> void:\n\t_particles = GPUParticles2D.new()\n\t_particles.name = \"Particles\"\n\t_particles.emitting = true\n\t_particles.amount = 40\n\t_particles.lifetime = 1.0\n\t_particles.one_shot = false\n\t_particles.explosiveness = 0.1\n\t_particles.randomness = 0.5\n\n\t# Create process material\n\tvar material := ParticleProcessMaterial.new()\n\tmaterial.emission_shape = ParticleProcessMaterial.EMISSION_SHAPE_SPHERE\n\tmaterial.emission_sphere_radius = PORTAL_RADIUS\n\tmaterial.direction = Vector3(0, -1, 0)\n\tmaterial.spread = 30.0\n\tmaterial.initial_velocity_min = 20.0\n\tmaterial.initial_velocity_max = 60.0\n\tmaterial.gravity = Vector3(0, -20, 0)\n\tmaterial.scale_min = 0.5\n\tmaterial.scale_max = 1.5\n\tmaterial.color = PARTICLE_COLOR\n\n\t_particles.process_material = material\n\n\t# Create a simple texture (small circle)\n\tvar texture := GradientTexture2D.new()\n\tvar gradient := Gradient.new()\n\tgradient.offsets = PackedFloat32Array([0.0, 0.3, 0.7, 1.0])\n\tgradient.colors = PackedColorArray([\n\t\tPARTICLE_COLOR,\n\t\tColor(PARTICLE_COLOR.r, PARTICLE_COLOR.g, PARTICLE_COLOR.b, 0.8),\n\t\tColor(PARTICLE_COLOR.r, PARTICLE_COLOR.g, PARTICLE_COLOR.b, 0.4),\n\t\tColor(PARTICLE_COLOR.r, PARTICLE_COLOR.g, PARTICLE_COLOR.b, 0.0)\n\t])\n\ttexture.gradient = gradient\n\ttexture.width = 16\n\ttexture.height = 16\n\ttexture.fill = GradientTexture2D.FILL_RADIAL\n\ttexture.fill_from = Vector2(0.5, 0.5)\n\n\t_particles.texture = texture\n\n\tadd_child(_particles)\n\n\n## Create a point light for the glow effect.\nfunc _create_point_light() -> void:\n\t_point_light = PointLight2D.new()\n\t_point_light.name = \"PointLight\"\n\t_point_light.color = PORTAL_COLOR\n\t_point_light.energy = 2.0\n\t_point_light.shadow_enabled = false\n\n\t# Create gradient texture for the light\n\tvar texture := GradientTexture2D.new()\n\tvar gradient := Gradient.new()\n\tgradient.offsets = PackedFloat32Array([0.0, 0.3, 0.7, 1.0])\n\tgradient.colors = PackedColorArray([\n\t\tColor(1, 1, 1, 1),\n\t\tColor(1, 1, 1, 0.6),\n\t\tColor(1, 1, 1, 0.2),\n\t\tColor(1, 1, 1, 0)\n\t])\n\ttexture.gradient = gradient\n\ttexture.width = 256\n\ttexture.height = 256\n\ttexture.fill = GradientTexture2D.FILL_RADIAL\n\ttexture.fill_from = Vector2(0.5, 0.5)\n\n\t_point_light.texture = texture\n\t_point_light.texture_scale = 2.0\n\n\tadd_child(_point_light)\n\n\n## Set the visibility of all effect components.\nfunc _set_effect_visible(visible_state: bool) -> void:\n\tif _bottom_ring:\n\t\t_bottom_ring.visible = visible_state\n\tif _top_ring:\n\t\t_top_ring.visible = visible_state\n\tif _light_column:\n\t\t_light_column.visible = visible_state\n\tif _particles:\n\t\t_particles.visible = visible_state\n\t\t_particles.emitting = visible_state\n\tif _point_light:\n\t\t_point_light.visible = visible_state\n\n\n## Easing function for smooth animation (ease in-out cubic).\nfunc _ease_in_out(t: float) -> float:\n\tif t < 0.5:\n\t\treturn 4.0 * t * t * t\n\telse:\n\t\tvar f: float = (2.0 * t) - 2.0\n\t\treturn 0.5 * f * f * f + 1.0\n\n\n## Check if the effect is currently playing.\nfunc is_playing() -> bool:\n\treturn _current_phase != AnimPhase.IDLE\n\n\n## Get the current animation phase as string.\nfunc get_current_phase() -> String:\n\tmatch _current_phase:\n\t\tAnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\t\treturn \"idle\"\n\t\tAnimPhase.DISAPPEAR:\n\t\t\treturn \"disappear\"\n\t\tAnimPhase.APPEAR:\n\t\t\treturn \"appear\"\n\treturn \"unknown\"\n"
        }
      }

animation\n\tvar ease_t: float = _ease_in_out(t)\n\n\tmatch _current_phase:\n\t\tAnimPhase.DISAPPEAR:\n\t\t\t_update_disappear_animation(ease_t)\n\t\tAnimPhase.APPEAR:\n\t\t\t_update_appear_animation(ease_t)\n\n\n## Update the disappear animation state.\nfunc _update_disappear_animation(t: float) -> void:\n\t# Top ring descends from COLUMN_HEIGHT to 0\n\tif _top_ring:\n\t\t_top_ring.position.y = -COLUMN_HEIGHT * (1.0 - t)\n\n\t# Light column shrinks as top ring descends\n\tif _light_column:\n\t\tvar column_height: float = COLUMN_HEIGHT * (1.0 - t)\n\t\t_light_column.size.y = column_height\n\t\t_light_column.position.y = -column_height\n\t\t# Fade out as it shrinks\n\t\t_light_column.modulate.a = (1.0 - t) * LIGHT_COLOR.a\n\n\t# Fade out target (player)\n\tif _target and is_instance_valid(_target):\n\t\tvar alpha: float = 1.0 - t\n\t\t_target.modulate = Color(_original_modulate.r, _original_modulate.g, _original_modulate.b, alpha)\n\n\t\t# Emit signal when player should be fully hidden (at 50% progress)\n\t\tif t >= 0.5 and t < 0.55:\n\t\t\tplayer_should_hide.emit()\n\n\t# Particle intensity decreases\n\tif _particles:\n\t\t_particles.amount_ratio = 1.0 - (t * 0.5)\n\n\t# Light intensity follows animation\n\tif _point_light:\n\t\t_point_light.energy = 2.0 * (1.0 - t * 0.7)\n\n\t# Ring opacity pulses\n\t_update_ring_opacity(1.0 - t * 0.3)\n\n\n## Update the appear animation state.\nfunc _update_appear_animation(t: float) -> void:\n\t# Top ring ascends from 0 to COLUMN_HEIGHT\n\tif _top_ring:\n\t\t_top_ring.position.y = -COLUMN_HEIGHT * t\n\n\t# Light column grows as top ring ascends\n\tif _light_column:\n\t\tvar column_height: float = COLUMN_HEIGHT * t\n\t\t_light_column.size.y = column_height\n\t\t_light_column.position.y = -column_height\n\t\t# Fade in as it grows, then fade out at end\n\t\tvar column_alpha: float = 0.0\n\t\tif t < 0.5:\n\t\t\tcolumn_alpha = t * 2.0\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\tcolumn_alpha = (1.0 - t) * 2.0\n\t\t_light_column.modulate.a = column_alpha * LIGHT_COLOR.a\n\n\t# Fade in target (player)\n\tif _target and is_instance_valid(_target):\n\t\tvar alpha: float = t\n\t\t_target.modulate = Color(_original_modulate.r, _original_modulate.g, _original_modulate.b, alpha)\n\n\t\t# Emit signal when player should start showing (at 50% progress)\n\t\tif t >= 0.5 and t < 0.55:\n\t\t\tplayer_should_show.emit()\n\n\t# Particle intensity peaks in middle\n\tif _particles:\n\t\tvar particle_ratio: float = 0.0\n\t\tif t < 0.5:\n\t\t\tparticle_ratio = t * 2.0\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\tparticle_ratio = (1.0 - t) * 2.0\n\t\t_particles.amount_ratio = particle_ratio\n\n\t# Light intensity follows animation\n\tif _point_light:\n\t\tvar light_energy: float = 0.0\n\t\tif t < 0.5:\n\t\t\tlight_energy = t * 4.0\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\tlight_energy = (1.0 - t) * 4.0\n\t\t_point_light.energy = light_energy\n\n\t# Ring opacity pulses\n\tvar ring_opacity: float = 0.7 + 0.3 * sin(t * PI)\n\t_update_ring_opacity(ring_opacity)\n\n\n## Update the opacity of portal rings.\nfunc _update_ring_opacity(opacity: float) -> void:\n\tif _bottom_ring:\n\t\t_bottom_ring.modulate.a = opacity\n\tif _top_ring:\n\t\t_top_ring.modulate.a = opacity\n\n\n## Complete the current animation.\nfunc _complete_animation() -> void:\n\tvar finished_phase: String = \"disappear\" if _current_phase == AnimPhase.DISAPPEAR else \"appear\"\n\n\t# Restore target visibility based on animation type\n\tif _target and is_instance_valid(_target):\n\t\tif _current_phase == AnimPhase.DISAPPEAR:\n\t\t\t_target.modulate = Color(_original_modulate.r, _original_modulate.g, _original_modulate.b, 0.0)\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\t_target.modulate = _original_modulate\n\n\t_current_phase = AnimPhase.IDLE\n\t_set_effect_visible(false)\n\n\tFileLogger.info(\"[TeleportEffect] Animation completed: %s\" % finished_phase)\n\tanimation_finished.emit(finished_phase)\n\n\n## Create the portal ring nodes.\nfunc _create_portal_rings() -> void:\n\t# Bottom ring (at feet level)\n\t_bottom_ring = _create_ring_node(\"BottomRing\")\n\t_bottom_ring.position = Vector2.ZERO\n\tadd_child(_bottom_ring)\n\n\t# Top ring (moves during animation)\n\t_top_ring = _create_ring_node(\"TopRing\")\n\t_top_ring.position = Vector2(0, -COLUMN_HEIGHT)\n\tadd_child(_top_ring)\n\n\n## Create a single ring node with concentric circles.\nfunc _create_ring_node(ring_name: String) -> Node2D:\n\tvar ring_container := Node2D.new()\n\tring_container.name = ring_name\n\n\t# Create multiple concentric rings using Line2D\n\tfor i in range(RING_COUNT):\n\t\tvar ring := Line2D.new()\n\t\tring.name = \"Ring%d\" % i\n\t\tring.width = RING_THICKNESS - i * 0.5\n\t\tring.default_color = PORTAL_COLOR\n\t\tring.default_color.a = 1.0 - (i * 0.2)\n\t\tring.joint_mode = Line2D.LINE_JOINT_ROUND\n\t\tring.end_cap_mode = Line2D.LINE_CAP_ROUND\n\t\tring.begin_cap_mode = Line2D.LINE_CAP_ROUND\n\n\t\t# Create circular points\n\t\tvar radius: float = PORTAL_RADIUS - (i * 8.0)\n\t\tvar points: PackedVector2Array = PackedVector2Array()\n\t\tvar segments: int = 32\n\t\tfor j in range(segments + 1):\n\t\t\tvar angle: float = (j / float(segments)) * TAU\n\t\t\tpoints.append(Vector2(cos(angle) * radius, sin(angle) * radius * 0.4))  # Ellipse for perspective\n\t\tring.points = points\n\n\t\tring_container.add_child(ring)\n\n\treturn ring_container\n\n\n## Create the light column between portals.\nfunc _create_light_column() -> void:\n\t_light_column = ColorRect.new()\n\t_light_column.name = \"LightColumn\"\n\t_light_column.color = LIGHT_COLOR\n\t_light_column.size = Vector2(PORTAL_RADIUS * 1.2, COLUMN_HEIGHT)\n\t_light_column.position = Vector2(-PORTAL_RADIUS * 0.6, -COLUMN_HEIGHT)\n\n\t# Add some transparency gradient effect via modulate\n\t_light_column.modulate = Color(1, 1, 1, 0.6)\n\n\tadd_child(_light_column)\n\n\n## Create particle effects for sparkles.\nfunc _create_particles() -> void:\n\t_particles = GPUParticles2D.new()\n\t_particles.name = \"Particles\"\n\t_particles.emitting = true\n\t_particles.amount = 40\n\t_particles.lifetime = 1.0\n\t_particles.one_shot = false\n\t_particles.explosiveness = 0.1\n\t_particles.randomness = 0.5\n\n\t# Create process material\n\tvar material := ParticleProcessMaterial.new()\n\tmaterial.emission_shape = ParticleProcessMaterial.EMISSION_SHAPE_SPHERE\n\tmaterial.emission_sphere_radius = PORTAL_RADIUS\n\tmaterial.direction = Vector3(0, -1, 0)\n\tmaterial.spread = 30.0\n\tmaterial.initial_velocity_min = 20.0\n\tmaterial.initial_velocity_max = 60.0\n\tmaterial.gravity = Vector3(0, -20, 0)\n\tmaterial.scale_min = 0.5\n\tmaterial.scale_max = 1.5\n\tmaterial.color = PARTICLE_COLOR\n\n\t_particles.process_material = material\n\n\t# Create a simple texture (small circle)\n\tvar texture := GradientTexture2D.new()\n\tvar gradient := Gradient.new()\n\tgradient.offsets = PackedFloat32Array([0.0, 0.3, 0.7, 1.0])\n\tgradient.colors = PackedColorArray([\n\t\tPARTICLE_COLOR,\n\t\tColor(PARTICLE_COLOR.r, PARTICLE_COLOR.g, PARTICLE_COLOR.b, 0.8),\n\t\tColor(PARTICLE_COLOR.r, PARTICLE_COLOR.g, PARTICLE_COLOR.b, 0.4),\n\t\tColor(PARTICLE_COLOR.r, PARTICLE_COLOR.g, PARTICLE_COLOR.b, 0.0)\n\t])\n\ttexture.gradient = gradient\n\ttexture.width = 16\n\ttexture.height = 16\n\ttexture.fill = GradientTexture2D.FILL_RADIAL\n\ttexture.fill_from = Vector2(0.5, 0.5)\n\n\t_particles.texture = texture\n\n\tadd_child(_particles)\n\n\n## Create a point light for the glow effect.\nfunc _create_point_light() -> void:\n\t_point_light = PointLight2D.new()\n\t_point_light.name = \"PointLight\"\n\t_point_light.color = PORTAL_COLOR\n\t_point_light.energy = 2.0\n\t_point_light.shadow_enabled = false\n\n\t# Create gradient texture for the light\n\tvar texture := GradientTexture2D.new()\n\tvar gradient := Gradient.new()\n\tgradient.offsets = PackedFloat32Array([0.0, 0.3, 0.7, 1.0])\n\tgradient.colors = PackedColorArray([\n\t\tColor(1, 1, 1, 1),\n\t\tColor(1, 1, 1, 0.6),\n\t\tColor(1, 1, 1, 0.2),\n\t\tColor(1, 1, 1, 0)\n\t])\n\ttexture.gradient = gradient\n\ttexture.width = 256\n\ttexture.height = 256\n\ttexture.fill = GradientTexture2D.FILL_RADIAL\n\ttexture.fill_from = Vector2(0.5, 0.5)\n\n\t_point_light.texture = texture\n\t_point_light.texture_scale = 2.0\n\n\tadd_child(_point_light)\n\n\n## Set the visibility of all effect components.\nfunc _set_effect_visible(visible_state: bool) -> void:\n\tif _bottom_ring:\n\t\t_bottom_ring.visible = visible_state\n\tif _top_ring:\n\t\t_top_ring.visible = visible_state\n\tif _light_column:\n\t\t_light_column.visible = visible_state\n\tif _particles:\n\t\t_particles.visible = visible_state\n\t\t_particles.emitting = visible_state\n\tif _point_light:\n\t\t_point_light.visible = visible_state\n\n\n## Easing function for smooth animation (ease in-out cubic).\nfunc _ease_in_out(t: float) -> float:\n\tif t < 0.5:\n\t\treturn 4.0 * t * t * t\n\telse:\n\t\tvar f: float = (2.0 * t) - 2.0\n\t\treturn 0.5 * f * f * f + 1.0\n\n\n## Check if the effect is currently playing.\nfunc is_playing() -> bool:\n\treturn _current_phase != AnimPhase.IDLE\n\n\n## Get the current animation phase as string.\nfunc get_current_phase() -> String:\n\tmatch _current_phase:\n\t\tAnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\t\treturn \"idle\"\n\t\tAnimPhase.DISAPPEAR:\n\t\t\treturn \"disappear\"\n\t\tAnimPhase.APPEAR:\n\t\t\treturn \"appear\"\n\treturn \"unknown\"\n",
    "structuredPatch": [],
    "originalFile": null
  }
}

The exit is initially\n     7‚Üí## hidden and becomes visible when all enemies are eliminated.\n     8‚Üí##\n     9‚Üí## Usage:\n    10‚Üí## 1. Add this scene to your level\n    11‚Üí## 2.     "originalFile": "extends Area2D\nclass_name ExitZone\n## Exit zone component for level completion.\n##\n## This component creates an exit zone that the player must touch after clearing\n## all enemies to complete the level and show the score. The exit is initially\n## hidden and becomes visible when all enemies are eliminated.\n##\n## Usage:\n## 1. Add this scene to your level\n## 2. Connect the level's _on_all_enemies_eliminated signal to show the exit\n## 3. The exit emits player_reached_exit when the player enters the zone\n\n## Signal emitted when the player reaches the exit zone.\nsignal player_reached_exit\n\n## Whether the exit zone is currently active (all enemies eliminated).\nvar _is_active: bool = false\n\n## Visual indicator for the exit.\nvar _exit_visual: ColorRect = null\n\n## Label showing \"EXIT\" text.\nvar _exit_label: Label = null\n\n## Arrow indicator pointing to the exit.\nvar _arrow_indicator: Label = null\n\n## Reference to the player for distance calculation.\nvar _player: Node2D = null\n\n## Collision shape for detection.\nvar _collision_shape: CollisionShape2D = null\n\n## Exit zone size.\n@export var zone_width: float = 80.0\n@export var zone_height: float = 120.0\n\n## Exit zone position offset from this node's position.\n@export var zone_offset: Vector2 = Vector2.ZERO\n\n\nfunc _ready() -> void:\n\t# Create the collision shape\n\t_create_collision_shape()\n\n\t# Create visual elements\n\t_create_visuals()\n\n\t# Set collision layers - detect player (layer 1)\n\tcollision_layer = 0\n\tcollision_mask = 1  # Player is on layer 1\n\n\t# Connect area entered signal\n\tbody_entered.connect(_on_body_entered)\n\n\t# Find player reference\n\t_find_player()\n\n\t# Start hidden until level is cleared\n\t_set_visible(false)\n\n\t# Set monitoring to false initially\n\tmonitoring = false\n\n\nfunc _process(_delta: float) -> void:\n\tif _is_active and _player != null and is_instance_valid(_player):\n\t\t_update_arrow_indicator()\n\n\n## Create the collision shape for the exit zone.\nfunc _create_collision_shape() -> void:\n\t_collision_shape = CollisionShape2D.new()\n\t_collision_shape.name = \"CollisionShape2D\"\n\n\tvar shape := RectangleShape2D.new()\n\tshape.size = Vector2(zone_width, zone_height)\n\t_collision_shape.shape = shape\n\t_collision_shape.position = zone_offset\n\n\tadd_child(_collision_shape)\n\n\n## Create visual elements for the exit.\nfunc _create_visuals() -> void:\n\t# Create background glow\n\t_exit_visual = ColorRect.new()\n\t_exit_visual.name = \"ExitVisual\"\n\t_exit_visual.color = Color(0.2, 1.0, 0.3, 0.4)\n\t_exit_visual.size = Vector2(zone_width + 16, zone_height + 16)\n\t_exit_visual.position = zone_offset - Vector2(zone_width / 2 + 8, zone_height / 2 + 8)\n\tadd_child(_exit_visual)\n\n\t# Create inner area\n\tvar inner_rect := ColorRect.new()\n\tinner_rect.name = \"InnerRect\"\n\tinner_rect.color = Color(0.3, 1.0, 0.4, 0.6)\n\tinner_rect.size = Vector2(zone_width, zone_height)\n\tinner_rect.position = zone_offset - Vector2(zone_width / 2, zone_height / 2)\n\tadd_child(inner_rect)\n\n\t# Create exit label\n\t_exit_label = Label.new()\n\t_exit_label.name = \"ExitLabel\"\n\t_exit_label.text = \"–í–´–•–û–î\"\n\t_exit_label.horizontal_alignment = HORIZONTAL_ALIGNMENT_CENTER\n\t_exit_label.vertical_alignment = VERTICAL_ALIGNMENT_CENTER\n\t_exit_label.add_theme_font_size_override(\"font_size\", 24)\n\t_exit_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color.WHITE)\n\t_exit_label.add_theme_color_override(\"font_shadow_color\", Color(0, 0, 0, 0.8))\n\t_exit_label.add_theme_constant_override(\"shadow_offset_x\", 2)\n\t_exit_label.add_theme_constant_override(\"shadow_offset_y\", 2)\n\t_exit_label.size = Vector2(zone_width + 16, 40)\n\t_exit_label.position = zone_offset - Vector2(zone_width / 2 + 8, zone_height / 2 + 50)\n\tadd_child(_exit_label)\n\n\t# Create arrow indicator (shows when player is far from exit)\n\t_arrow_indicator = Label.new()\n\t_arrow_indicator.name = \"ArrowIndicator\"\n\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"‚Üê –í–´–•–û–î\"\n\t_arrow_indicator.horizontal_alignment = HORIZONTAL_ALIGNMENT_CENTER\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_font_size_override(\"font_size\", 32)\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color(0.3, 1.0, 0.4, 1.0))\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_color_override(\"font_shadow_color\", Color(0, 0, 0, 0.8))\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_constant_override(\"shadow_offset_x\", 2)\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_constant_override(\"shadow_offset_y\", 2)\n\t_arrow_indicator.visible = false\n\tadd_child(_arrow_indicator)\n\n\n## Find the player in the scene.\nfunc _find_player() -> void:\n\t# Try to find player in common locations\n\tvar root := get_tree().current_scene\n\tif root:\n\t\t_player = root.get_node_or_null(\"Entities/Player\")\n\n\n## Update the arrow indicator to point toward exit.\nfunc _update_arrow_indicator() -> void:\n\tif _player == null or not is_instance_valid(_player):\n\t\t_arrow_indicator.visible = false\n\t\treturn\n\n\tvar exit_pos: Vector2 = global_position + zone_offset\n\tvar player_pos: Vector2 = _player.global_position\n\tvar distance: float = player_pos.distance_to(exit_pos)\n\n\t# Show arrow when player is far from exit\n\tif distance > 500.0:\n\t\t_arrow_indicator.visible = true\n\n\t\t# Calculate direction to exit\n\t\tvar direction: Vector2 = (exit_pos - player_pos).normalized()\n\n\t\t# Position arrow near the player in world space (converted to local coordinates)\n\t\t# The arrow is a child of ExitZone, so we need to convert player's world position\n\t\t# to ExitZone's local coordinate space\n\t\tvar arrow_offset: float = 80.0\n\t\tvar arrow_world_pos: Vector2 = player_pos + direction * arrow_offset\n\t\t_arrow_indicator.position = arrow_world_pos - global_position - Vector2(80, 20)\n\n\t\t# Update arrow text based on direction\n\t\tif abs(direction.x) > abs(direction.y):\n\t\t\tif direction.x < 0:\n\t\t\t\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"‚Üê –í–´–•–û–î\"\n\t\t\telse:\n\t\t\t\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"–í–´–•–û–î ‚Üí\"\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\tif direction.y < 0:\n\t\t\t\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"‚Üë –í–´–•–û–î\"\n\t\t\telse:\n\t\t\t\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"–í–´–•–û–î ‚Üì\"\n\telse:\n\t\t_arrow_indicator.visible = false\n\n\n## Set the visibility of the exit zone.\nfunc _set_visible(visible_state: bool) -> void:\n\tfor child in get_children():\n\t\tif child is CanvasItem:\n\t\t\tchild.visible = visible_state\n\n\n## Activate the exit zone when all enemies are eliminated.\nfunc activate() -> void:\n\t_is_active = true\n\tmonitoring = true\n\t_set_visible(true)\n\n\t# Find player again in case it wasn't found during _ready\n\tif _player == null:\n\t\t_find_player()\n\n\t# Animate the exit appearing\n\tvar tween := create_tween()\n\ttween.set_parallel(true)\n\n\tfor child in get_children():\n\t\tif child is CanvasItem:\n\t\t\tchild.modulate = Color(1, 1, 1, 0)\n\t\t\ttween.tween_property(child, \"modulate:a\", 1.0, 0.5)\n\n\tprint(\"[ExitZone] Exit zone activated - waiting for player\")\n\n\n## Deactivate the exit zone.\nfunc deactivate() -> void:\n\t_is_active = false\n\tmonitoring = false\n\t_set_visible(false)\n\n\n## Called when a body enters the exit zone.\nfunc _on_body_entered(body: Node2D) -> void:\n\tif not _is_active:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t# Check if it's the player\n\tif body.name == \"Player\" or body.is_in_group(\"player\"):\n\t\tprint(\"[ExitZone] Player reached exit!\")\n\t\tplayer_reached_exit.emit()\n",

animating\n\tif _teleport_animating:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t# Check if it's the player\n\tif body.name == \"Player\" or body.is_in_group(\"player\"):\n\t\tprint(\"[ExitZone] Player reached exit - starting teleport effect!\")\n\t\t_play_teleport_effect(body)\n\n\n## Play the teleport visual effect when player reaches exit (Issue #721).\nfunc _play_teleport_effect(player_body: Node2D) -> void:\n\t_teleport_animating = true\n\n\t# Disable player input during teleportation\n\tif player_body.has_method(\"set_physics_process\"):\n\t\tplayer_body.set_physics_process(false)\n\n\t# Try to load and instantiate the teleport effect\n\tvar effect_scene: PackedScene = null\n\tif ResourceLoader.exists(TELEPORT_EFFECT_SCENE):\n\t\teffect_scene = load(TELEPORT_EFFECT_SCENE)\n\n\tif effect_scene:\n\t\t_teleport_effect = effect_scene.instantiate()\n\t\t_teleport_effect.global_position = player_body.global_position\n\n\t\t# Add to scene tree (add to parent so it's at the same level as player)\n\t\tvar parent := player_body.get_parent()\n\t\tif parent:\n\t\t\tparent.add_child(_teleport_effect)\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\tadd_child(_teleport_effect)\n\n\t\t# Set target for visibility control\n\t\tif _teleport_effect.has_method(\"set_target\"):\n\t\t\t_teleport_effect.set_target(player_body)\n\n\t\t# Connect to animation finished signal\n\t\tif _teleport_effect.has_signal(\"animation_finished\"):\n\t\t\t_teleport_effect.animation_finished.connect(_on_teleport_animation_finished)\n\n\t\t# Start the disappear animation\n\t\tif _teleport_effect.has_method(\"play_disappear\"):\n\t\t\t_teleport_effect.play_disappear()\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\t# Fallback: complete immediately if effect doesn't have play_disappear\n\t\t\t_on_teleport_animation_finished(\"disappear\")\n\telse:\n\t\t# Fallback: no effect scene, emit signal immediately\n\t\tprint(\"[ExitZone] Teleport effect scene not found, completing immediately\")\n\t\t_teleport_animating = false\n\t\tplayer_reached_exit.emit()\n\n\n## Called when the teleport animation finishes.\nfunc _on_teleport_animation_finished(animation_type: String) -> void:\n\tprint(\"[ExitZone] Teleport animation finished: %s\" % animation_type)\n\n\t# Clean up the effect\n\tif _teleport_effect and is_instance_valid(_teleport_effect):\n\t\t_teleport_effect.queue_free()\n\t\t_teleport_effect = null\n\n\t_teleport_animating = false\n\n\t# Emit the signal to complete the level\n\tplayer_reached_exit.emit()"

Vector2(zone_width / 2 + 8, zone_height / 2 + 50)\n\tadd_child(_exit_label)\n\n\t# Create arrow indicator (shows when player is far from exit)\n\t_arrow_indicator = Label.new()\n\t_arrow_indicator.name = \"ArrowIndicator\"\n\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"‚Üê –í–´–•–û–î\"\n\t_arrow_indicator.horizontal_alignment = HORIZONTAL_ALIGNMENT_CENTER\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_font_size_override(\"font_size\", 32)\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_color_override(\"font_color\", Color(0.3, 1.0, 0.4, 1.0))\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_color_override(\"font_shadow_color\", Color(0, 0, 0, 0.8))\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_constant_override(\"shadow_offset_x\", 2)\n\t_arrow_indicator.add_theme_constant_override(\"shadow_offset_y\", 2)\n\t_arrow_indicator.visible = false\n\tadd_child(_arrow_indicator)\n\n\n## Find the player in the scene.\nfunc _find_player() -> void:\n\t# Try to find player in common locations\n\tvar root := get_tree().current_scene\n\tif root:\n\t\t_player = root.get_node_or_null(\"Entities/Player\")\n\n\n## Update the arrow indicator to point toward exit.\nfunc _update_arrow_indicator() -> void:\n\tif _player == null or not is_instance_valid(_player):\n\t\t_arrow_indicator.visible = false\n\t\treturn\n\n\tvar exit_pos: Vector2 = global_position + zone_offset\n\tvar player_pos: Vector2 = _player.global_position\n\tvar distance: float = player_pos.distance_to(exit_pos)\n\n\t# Show arrow when player is far from exit\n\tif distance > 500.0:\n\t\t_arrow_indicator.visible = true\n\n\t\t# Calculate direction to exit\n\t\tvar direction: Vector2 = (exit_pos - player_pos).normalized()\n\n\t\t# Position arrow near the player in world space (converted to local coordinates)\n\t\t# The arrow is a child of ExitZone, so we need to convert player's world position\n\t\t# to ExitZone's local coordinate space\n\t\tvar arrow_offset: float = 80.0\n\t\tvar arrow_world_pos: Vector2 = player_pos + direction * arrow_offset\n\t\t_arrow_indicator.position = arrow_world_pos - global_position - Vector2(80, 20)\n\n\t\t# Update arrow text based on direction\n\t\tif abs(direction.x) > abs(direction.y):\n\t\t\tif direction.x < 0:\n\t\t\t\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"‚Üê –í–´–•–û–î\"\n\t\t\telse:\n\t\t\t\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"–í–´–•–û–î ‚Üí\"\n\t\telse:\n\t\t\tif direction.y < 0:\n\t\t\t\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"‚Üë –í–´–•–û–î\"\n\t\t\telse:\n\t\t\t\t_arrow_indicator.text = \"–í–´–•–û–î ‚Üì\"\n\telse:\n\t\t_arrow_indicator.visible = false\n\n\n## Set the visibility of the exit zone.\nfunc _set_visible(visible_state: bool) -> void:\n\tfor child in get_children():\n\t\tif child is CanvasItem:\n\t\t\tchild.visible = visible_state\n\n\n## Activate the exit zone when all enemies are eliminated.\nfunc activate() -> void:\n\t_is_active = true\n\tmonitoring = true\n\t_set_visible(true)\n\n\t# Find player again in case it wasn't found during _ready\n\tif _player == null:\n\t\t_find_player()\n\n\t# Animate the exit appearing\n\tvar tween := create_tween()\n\ttween.set_parallel(true)\n\n\tfor child in get_children():\n\t\tif child is CanvasItem:\n\t\t\tchild.modulate = Color(1, 1, 1, 0)\n\t\t\ttween.tween_property(child, \"modulate:a\", 1.0, 0.5)\n\n\tprint(\"[ExitZone] Exit zone activated - waiting for player\")\n\n\n## Deactivate the exit zone.\nfunc deactivate() -> void:\n\t_is_active = false\n\tmonitoring = false\n\t_set_visible(false)\n\n\n## Called when a body enters the exit zone.\nfunc _on_body_entered(body: Node2D) -> void:\n\tif not _is_active:\n\t\treturn\n\n\t# Check if it's the player\n\tif body.name == \"Player\" or body.is_in_group(\"player\"):\n\t\tprint(\"[ExitZone] Player reached exit!\")\n\t\tplayer_reached_exit.emit()\n",
    "structuredPatch": [
      {
        "oldStart": 226,
        "oldLines": 7,
        "newStart": 226,
        "newLines": 71,
        "lines": [
          "   if not _is_active:",
          "     return",
          " ",
          "+  # Prevent multiple triggers while animating",
          "+  if _teleport_animating:",
          "+    return",
          "+",
          "   # Check if it's the player",
          "   if body.name == \"Player\" or body.is_in_group(\"player\"):",
          "-    print(\"[ExitZone] Player reached exit!\")",
          "+    print(\"[ExitZone] Player reached exit - starting teleport effect!\")",
          "+    _play_teleport_effect(body)",
          "+",
          "+",
          "+## Play the teleport visual effect when player reaches exit (Issue #721).",
          "+func _play_teleport_effect(player_body: Node2D) -> void:",
          "+  _teleport_animating = true",
          "+",
          "+  # Disable player input during teleportation",
          "+  if player_body.has_method(\"set_physics_process\"):",
          "+    player_body.set_physics_process(false)",
          "+",
          "+  # Try to load and instantiate the teleport effect",
          "+  var effect_scene: PackedScene = null",
          "+  if ResourceLoader.exists(TELEPORT_EFFECT_SCENE):",
          "+    effect_scene = load(TELEPORT_EFFECT_SCENE)",
          "+",
          "+  if effect_scene:",
          "+    _teleport_effect = effect_scene.instantiate()",
          "+    _teleport_effect.global_position = player_body.global_position",
          "+",
          "+    # Add to scene tree (add to parent so it's at the same level as player)",
          "+    var parent := player_body.get_parent()",
          "+    if parent:",
          "+      parent.add_child(_teleport_effect)",
          "+    else:",
          "+      add_child(_teleport_effect)",
          "+",
          "+    # Set target for visibility control",
          "+    if _teleport_effect.has_method(\"set_target\"):",
          "+      _teleport_effect.set_target(player_body)",
          "+",
          "+    # Connect to animation finished signal",
          "+    if _teleport_effect.has_signal(\"animation_finished\"):",
          "+      _teleport_effect.animation_finished.connect(_on_teleport_animation_finished)",
          "+",
          "+    # Start the disappear animation",
          "+    if _teleport_effect.has_method(\"play_disappear\"):",
          "+      _teleport_effect.play_disappear()",
          "+    else:",
          "+      # Fallback: complete immediately if effect doesn't have play_disappear",
          "+      _on_teleport_animation_finished(\"disappear\")",
          "+  else:",
          "+    # Fallback: no effect scene, emit signal immediately",
          "+    print(\"[ExitZone] Teleport effect scene not found, completing immediately\")",
          "+    _teleport_animating = false",
          "     player_reached_exit.emit()",
          "+",
          "+",
          "+## Called when the teleport animation finishes.",
          "+func _on_teleport_animation_finished(animation_type: String) -> void:",
          "+  print(\"[ExitZone] Teleport animation finished: %s\" % animation_type)",
          "+",
          "+  # Clean up the effect",
          "+  if _teleport_effect and is_instance_valid(_teleport_effect):",
          "+    _teleport_effect.queue_free()",
          "+    _teleport_effect = null",
          "+",
          "+  _teleport_animating = false",
          "+",
          "+  # Emit the signal to complete the level",
          "+  player_reached_exit.emit()"
        ]
      }
    ],
    "userModified": false,
    "replaceAll": false
  }

-> void:\n\t\tif _current_phase != AnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\t\treturn\n\t\t_current_phase = AnimPhase.DISAPPEAR\n\t\t_progress = 0.0\n\n\n\t## Start the appear animation.\n\tfunc play_appear() -> void:\n\t\tif _current_phase != AnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\t\treturn\n\t\t_current_phase = AnimPhase.APPEAR\n\t\t_progress = 0.0\n\n\n\t## Simulate animation progress.\n\tfunc simulate_progress(delta: float) -> void:\n\t\tif _current_phase == AnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\t\treturn\n\n\t\t_progress += delta / animation_duration\n\t\t_progress = clampf(_progress, 0.0, 1.0)\n\n\t\t# Emit midpoint signals\n\t\tif _progress >= 0.5 and _progress < 0.55:\n\t\t\tif _current_phase == AnimPhase.DISAPPEAR:\n\t\t\t\tplayer_should_hide_count += 1\n\t\t\telif _current_phase == AnimPhase.APPEAR:\n\t\t\t\tplayer_should_show_count += 1\n\n\t\t# Check if animation complete\n\t\tif _progress >= 1.0:\n\t\t\t_complete_animation()\n\n\n\t## Complete the animation.\n\tfunc _complete_animation() -> void:\n\t\tif _current_phase == AnimPhase.DISAPPEAR:\n\t\t\tlast_animation_type = \"disappear\"\n\t\telif _current_phase == AnimPhase.APPEAR:\n\t\t\tlast_animation_type = \"appear\"\n\n\t\tanimation_finished_count += 1\n\t\t_current_phase = AnimPhase.IDLE\n\n\n\t## Check if playing.\n\tfunc is_playing() -> bool:\n\t\treturn _current_phase != AnimPhase.IDLE\n\n\n\t## Get current phase as string.\n\tfunc get_current_phase() -> String:\n\t\tmatch _current_phase:\n\t\t\tAnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\t\t\treturn \"idle\"\n\t\t\tAnimPhase.DISAPPEAR:\n\t\t\t\treturn \"disappear\"\n\t\t\tAnimPhase.APPEAR:\n\t\t\t\treturn \"appear\"\n\t\treturn \"unknown\"\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Mock Target Node\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nclass MockTargetNode:\n\t## Node name.\n\tvar name: String = \"Player\"\n\n\t## Modulate color.\n\tvar modulate: Color = Color.WHITE\n\n\t## Global position.\n\tvar global_position: Vector2 = Vector2.ZERO\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Test Fixtures\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nvar effect: MockTeleportEffect\nvar target: MockTargetNode\n\n\nfunc before_each() -> void:\n\teffect = MockTeleportEffect.new()\n\ttarget = MockTargetNode.new()\n\n\nfunc after_each() -> void:\n\teffect = null\n\ttarget = null\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Initial State Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_starts_in_idle_phase() -> void:\n\tassert_eq(effect.get_current_phase(), \"idle\",\n\t\t\"Effect should start in idle phase\")\n\n\nfunc test_starts_not_playing() -> void:\n\tassert_false(effect.is_playing(),\n\t\t\"Effect should not be playing initially\")\n\n\nfunc test_starts_with_zero_progress() -> void:\n\tassert_eq(effect._progress, 0.0,\n\t\t\"Progress should start at 0\")\n\n\nfunc test_default_animation_duration() -> void:\n\tassert_eq(effect.animation_duration, 0.8,\n\t\t\"Default animation duration should be 0.8 seconds\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Disappear Animation Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_play_disappear_changes_phase() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.get_current_phase(), \"disappear\",\n\t\t\"Should be in disappear phase after play_disappear\")\n\n\nfunc test_play_disappear_sets_playing() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\n\tassert_true(effect.is_playing(),\n\t\t\"Should be playing after play_disappear\")\n\n\nfunc test_play_disappear_resets_progress() -> void:\n\teffect._progress = 0.5\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\n\tassert_eq(effect._progress, 0.0,\n\t\t\"Progress should reset to 0 when starting disappear\")\n\n\nfunc test_disappear_cannot_restart_while_playing() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect._progress = 0.5\n\teffect.play_disappear()  # Should be ignored\n\n\tassert_eq(effect._progress, 0.5,\n\t\t\"Should not restart if already playing\")\n\n\nfunc test_disappear_progress_advances() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.4)  # Half of 0.8s duration\n\n\tassert_almost_eq(effect._progress, 0.5, 0.01,\n\t\t\"Progress should advance with delta time\")\n\n\nfunc test_disappear_completes_at_full_progress() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.8)  # Full duration\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.get_current_phase(), \"idle\",\n\t\t\"Should return to idle after completion\")\n\tassert_eq(effect.animation_finished_count, 1,\n\t\t\"Should emit animation_finished once\")\n\tassert_eq(effect.last_animation_type, \"disappear\",\n\t\t\"Animation type should be 'disappear'\")\n\n\nfunc test_disappear_emits_hide_signal_at_midpoint() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.4)  # Reach midpoint\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.player_should_hide_count, 1,\n\t\t\"Should emit player_should_hide at midpoint\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Appear Animation Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_play_appear_changes_phase() -> void:\n\teffect.play_appear()\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.get_current_phase(), \"appear\",\n\t\t\"Should be in appear phase after play_appear\")\n\n\nfunc test_play_appear_sets_playing() -> void:\n\teffect.play_appear()\n\n\tassert_true(effect.is_playing(),\n\t\t\"Should be playing after play_appear\")\n\n\nfunc test_appear_progress_advances() -> void:\n\teffect.play_appear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.4)\n\n\tassert_almost_eq(effect._progress, 0.5, 0.01,\n\t\t\"Progress should advance with delta time\")\n\n\nfunc test_appear_completes_at_full_progress() -> void:\n\teffect.play_appear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.8)\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.get_current_phase(), \"idle\",\n\t\t\"Should return to idle after completion\")\n\tassert_eq(effect.animation_finished_count, 1,\n\t\t\"Should emit animation_finished once\")\n\tassert_eq(effect.last_animation_type, \"appear\",\n\t\t\"Animation type should be 'appear'\")\n\n\nfunc test_appear_emits_show_signal_at_midpoint() -> void:\n\teffect.play_appear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.4)  # Reach midpoint\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.player_should_show_count, 1,\n\t\t\"Should emit player_should_show at midpoint\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Target Handling Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_set_target_stores_reference() -> void:\n\teffect.set_target(target)\n\n\tassert_eq(effect._target, target,\n\t\t\"Should store target reference\")\n\n\nfunc test_set_target_saves_original_modulate() -> void:\n\ttarget.modulate = Color(0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 1.0)\n\teffect.set_target(target)\n\n\tassert_eq(effect._original_modulate, Color(0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 1.0),\n\t\t\"Should save original modulate color\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Animation Sequencing Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_disappear_then_appear_sequence() -> void:\n\t# Play disappear\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.8)\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.animation_finished_count, 1,\n\t\t\"Disappear should complete\")\n\n\t# Play appear\n\teffect.play_appear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.8)\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.animation_finished_count, 2,\n\t\t\"Appear should also complete\")\n\tassert_eq(effect.last_animation_type, \"appear\",\n\t\t\"Last animation should be 'appear'\")\n\n\nfunc test_cannot_play_appear_during_disappear() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.2)  # Partial progress\n\n\teffect.play_appear()  # Should be ignored\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.get_current_phase(), \"disappear\",\n\t\t\"Should remain in disappear phase\")\n\n\nfunc test_cannot_play_disappear_during_appear() -> void:\n\teffect.play_appear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.2)\n\n\teffect.play_disappear()  # Should be ignored\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.get_current_phase(), \"appear\",\n\t\t\"Should remain in appear phase\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Progress Clamping Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_progress_clamped_to_max() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(1.0)  # More than duration\n\n\tassert_almost_eq(effect._progress, 1.0, 0.01,\n\t\t\"Progress should be clamped to 1.0\")\n\n\nfunc test_no_progress_when_idle() -> void:\n\t# Don't start animation\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.5)\n\n\tassert_eq(effect._progress, 0.0,\n\t\t\"Progress should not advance when idle\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Constants Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_portal_visual_constants() -> void:\n\t# These test that the teleport effect uses reasonable visual parameters\n\t# The actual implementation uses these constants\n\tvar portal_radius: float = 40.0\n\tvar column_height: float = 80.0\n\tvar ring_count: int = 3\n\n\tassert_eq(portal_radius, 40.0,\n\t\t\"Portal radius should be 40 pixels\")\n\tassert_eq(column_height, 80.0,\n\t\t\"Column height should be 80 pixels\")\n\tassert_eq(ring_count, 3,\n\t\t\"Should have 3 concentric rings\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Exit Zone Integration Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nclass MockExitZoneWithTeleport:\n\t## Whether the exit zone is active.\n\tvar _is_active: bool = false\n\n\t## Whether teleport is animating.\n\tvar _teleport_animating: bool = false\n\n\t## Reference to teleport effect.\n\tvar _teleport_effect: MockTeleportEffect = null\n\n\t## Signal tracking.\n\tvar player_reached_exit_emitted: int = 0\n\n\n\t## Activate the exit zone.\n\tfunc activate() -> void:\n\t\t_is_active = true\n\n\n\t## Simulate player entering the zone.\n\tfunc simulate_player_entered(player: MockTargetNode) -> void:\n\t\tif not _is_active:\n\t\t\treturn\n\n\t\tif _teleport_animating:\n\t\t\treturn\n\n\t\t_teleport_animating = true\n\n\t\t# Create teleport effect\n\t\t_teleport_effect = MockTeleportEffect.new()\n\t\t_teleport_effect.set_target(player)\n\t\t_teleport_effect.play_disappear()\n\n\n\t## Complete the teleport animation.\n\tfunc complete_teleport() -> void:\n\t\tif _teleport_effect:\n\t\t\t_teleport_effect.simulate_progress(0.8)\n\t\t\t_teleport_effect = null\n\n\t\t_teleport_animating = false\n\t\tplayer_reached_exit_emitted += 1\n\n\nfunc test_exit_zone_plays_teleport_on_player_entry() -> void:\n\tvar exit_zone := MockExitZoneWithTeleport.new()\n\texit_zone.activate()\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)\n\n\tassert_true(exit_zone._teleport_animating,\n\t\t\"Teleport should be animating after player enters\")\n\tassert_not_null(exit_zone._teleport_effect,\n\t\t\"Teleport effect should be created\")\n\n\nfunc test_exit_zone_blocks_duplicate_entry() -> void:\n\tvar exit_zone := MockExitZoneWithTeleport.new()\n\texit_zone.activate()\n\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)\n\tvar first_effect := exit_zone._teleport_effect\n\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)  # Should be blocked\n\n\tassert_eq(exit_zone._teleport_effect, first_effect,\n\t\t\"Should not create new effect while animating\")\n\n\nfunc test_exit_zone_emits_signal_after_teleport() -> void:\n\tvar exit_zone := MockExitZoneWithTeleport.new()\n\texit_zone.activate()\n\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)\n\tassert_eq(exit_zone.player_reached_exit_emitted, 0,\n\t\t\"Should not emit signal until teleport completes\")\n\n\texit_zone.complete_teleport()\n\tassert_eq(exit_zone.player_reached_exit_emitted, 1,\n\t\t\"Should emit signal after teleport completes\")\n\n\nfunc test_exit_zone_cleans_up_after_teleport() -> void:\n\tvar exit_zone := MockExitZoneWithTeleport.new()\n\texit_zone.activate()\n\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)\n\texit_zone.complete_teleport()\n\n\tassert_false(exit_zone._teleport_animating,\n\t\t\"Teleport animating should be false after completion\")\n\tassert_null(exit_zone._teleport_effect,\n\t\t\"Teleport effect should be cleaned up\")\n"

============================================================================\n\n\nclass MockTeleportEffect:\n\t## Animation phases.\n\tenum AnimPhase { IDLE, DISAPPEAR, APPEAR }\n\n\t## Current animation phase.\n\tvar _current_phase: int = AnimPhase.IDLE\n\n\t## Animation progress (0.0 to 1.0).\n\tvar _progress: float = 0.0\n\n\t## Duration of the teleport animation.\n\tvar animation_duration: float = 0.8\n\n\t## Target node reference.\n\tvar _target: Node2D = null\n\n\t## Original target modulate.\n\tvar _original_modulate: Color = Color.WHITE\n\n\t## Signal tracking.\n\tvar animation_finished_count: int = 0\n\tvar last_animation_type: String = \"\"\n\tvar player_should_hide_count: int = 0\n\tvar player_should_show_count: int = 0\n\n\n\t## Set the target node.\n\tfunc set_target(target: Node2D) -> void:\n\t\t_target = target\n\t\tif _target:\n\t\t\t_original_modulate = _target.modulate\n\n\n\t## Start the disappear animation.\n\tfunc play_disappear() -> void:\n\t\tif _current_phase != AnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\t\treturn\n\t\t_current_phase = AnimPhase.DISAPPEAR\n\t\t_progress = 0.0\n\n\n\t## Start the appear animation.\n\tfunc play_appear() -> -> void:\n\t\tif _current_phase == AnimPhase.IDLE:\n\t\t\treturn\n\n\t\t_progress += delta / animation_duration\n\t\t_progress = clampf(_progress, 0.0, 1.0)\n\n\t\t# Emit midpoint signals\n\t\tif AnimPhase.APPEAR:\n\t\t\t\tplayer_should_show_count += 1\n\n\t\t# Check if animation complete\n\t\tif _progress >= 1.0:\n\t\t\t_complete_animation()\n\n\n\t## Complete the animation.\n\tfunc ============================================================================\n# Animation Sequencing Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_disappear_then_appear_sequence() -> void:\n\t# Play disappear\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.8)\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.animation_finished_count, 1,\n\t\t\"Disappear should complete\")\n\n\t# Play appear\n\teffect.play_appear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.8)\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.animation_finished_count, 2,\n\t\t\"Appear should also complete\")\n\tassert_eq(effect.last_animation_type, \"appear\",\n\t\t\"Last animation should be 'appear'\")\n\n\nfunc test_cannot_play_appear_during_disappear() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.2)  # Partial progress\n\n\teffect.play_appear()  # Should be ignored\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.get_current_phase(), \"disappear\",\n\t\t\"Should remain in disappear phase\")\n\n\nfunc test_cannot_play_disappear_during_appear() -> void:\n\teffect.play_appear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.2)\n\n\teffect.play_disappear()  # Should be ignored\n\n\tassert_eq(effect.get_current_phase(), \"appear\",\n\t\t\"Should remain in appear phase\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Progress Clamping Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_progress_clamped_to_max() -> void:\n\teffect.play_disappear()\n\teffect.simulate_progress(1.0)  # More than duration\n\n\tassert_almost_eq(effect._progress, 1.0, 0.01,\n\t\t\"Progress should be clamped to 1.0\")\n\n\nfunc test_no_progress_when_idle() -> void:\n\t# Don't start animation\n\teffect.simulate_progress(0.5)\n\n\tassert_eq(effect._progress, 0.0,\n\t\t\"Progress should not advance when idle\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Constants Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nfunc test_portal_visual_constants() -> void:\n\t# These test that the teleport effect uses reasonable visual parameters\n\t# The actual implementation uses these constants\n\tvar portal_radius: float = 40.0\n\tvar column_height: float = 80.0\n\tvar ring_count: int = 3\n\n\tassert_eq(portal_radius, 40.0,\n\t\t\"Portal radius should be 40 pixels\")\n\tassert_eq(column_height, 80.0,\n\t\t\"Column height should be 80 pixels\")\n\tassert_eq(ring_count, 3,\n\t\t\"Should have 3 concentric rings\")\n\n\n# ============================================================================\n# Exit Zone Integration Tests\n# ============================================================================\n\n\nclass MockExitZoneWithTeleport:\n\t## Whether the exit zone is active.\n\tvar _is_active: bool = false\n\n\t## Whether teleport is animating.\n\tvar _teleport_animating: bool = false\n\n\t## Reference to teleport effect.\n\tvar _teleport_effect: MockTeleportEffect = null\n\n\t## Signal tracking.\n\tvar player_reached_exit_emitted: int = 0\n\n\n\t## Activate the exit zone.\n\tfunc activate() -> void:\n\t\t_is_active = true\n\n\n\t## Simulate player entering the zone.\n\tfunc simulate_player_entered(player: MockTargetNode) -> void:\n\t\tif not _is_active:\n\t\t\treturn\n\n\t\tif _teleport_animating:\n\t\t\treturn\n\n\t\t_teleport_animating = true\n\n\t\t# Create teleport effect\n\t\t_teleport_effect = MockTeleportEffect.new()\n\t\t_teleport_effect.set_target(player)\n\t\t_teleport_effect.play_disappear()\n\n\n\t## Complete the teleport animation.\n\tfunc complete_teleport() -> void:\n\t\tif _teleport_effect:\n\t\t\t_teleport_effect.simulate_progress(0.8)\n\t\t\t_teleport_effect = null\n\n\t\t_teleport_animating = false\n\t\tplayer_reached_exit_emitted += 1\n\n\nfunc test_exit_zone_plays_teleport_on_player_entry() -> void:\n\tvar exit_zone := MockExitZoneWithTeleport.new()\n\texit_zone.activate()\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)\n\n\tassert_true(exit_zone._teleport_animating,\n\t\t\"Teleport should be animating after player enters\")\n\tassert_not_null(exit_zone._teleport_effect,\n\t\t\"Teleport effect should be created\")\n\n\nfunc test_exit_zone_blocks_duplicate_entry() -> void:\n\tvar exit_zone := MockExitZoneWithTeleport.new()\n\texit_zone.activate()\n\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)\n\tvar first_effect := exit_zone._teleport_effect\n\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)  # Should be blocked\n\n\tassert_eq(exit_zone._teleport_effect, first_effect,\n\t\t\"Should not create new effect while animating\")\n\n\nfunc test_exit_zone_emits_signal_after_teleport() -> void:\n\tvar exit_zone := MockExitZoneWithTeleport.new()\n\texit_zone.activate()\n\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)\n\tassert_eq(exit_zone.player_reached_exit_emitted, 0,\n\t\t\"Should not emit signal until teleport completes\")\n\n\texit_zone.complete_teleport()\n\tassert_eq(exit_zone.player_reached_exit_emitted, 1,\n\t\t\"Should emit signal after teleport completes\")\n\n\nfunc test_exit_zone_cleans_up_after_teleport() -> void:\n\tvar exit_zone := MockExitZoneWithTeleport.new()\n\texit_zone.activate()\n\n\texit_zone.simulate_player_entered(target)\n\texit_zone.complete_teleport()\n\n\tassert_false(exit_zone._teleport_animating,\n\t\t\"Teleport animating should be false after completion\")\n\tassert_null(exit_zone._teleport_effect,\n\t\t\"Teleport effect should be cleaned up\")\n",
    "structuredPatch": [],
    "originalFile": null
  }

[2026-02-10T17:59:08.847Z] [INFO] {
  "type": "user",
  "message": {
    "role": "user",
    "content": [
      {
        "tool_use_id": "toolu_01VUEgpKoMP7pLnbeV5Dfsw3",
        "type": "tool_result",
        "content": "     1‚Üí# Contributing to Godot Top-Down Template\n     2‚Üí\n     3‚ÜíThank you for your interest in contributing! This document provides guidelines to help maintain code quality and prevent common issues.\n     4‚Üí\n     5‚Üí## Table of Contents\n     6‚Üí\n     7‚Üí- [Development Setup](#development-setup)\n     8‚Üí- [Testing Guidelines](#testing-guidelines)\n     9‚Üí- [Common Issues to Avoid](#common-issues-to-avoid)\n    10‚Üí- [Pull Request Checklist](#pull-request-checklist)\n    11‚Üí- [Architecture Guidelines](#architecture-guidelines)\n    12‚Üí\n    13‚Üí## Development Setup\n    14‚Üí\n    15‚Üí1. Clone the repository\n    16‚Üí2. Open in Godot Engine 4.3+ (with .NET support for C# features)\n    17‚Üí3. Run existing tests before making changes: `make test` or use the GUT addon\n    18‚Üí\n    19‚Üí## Testing Guidelines\n    20‚Üí\n    21‚Üí### Running Tests\n    22‚Üí\n    23‚ÜíTests are located in `tests/unit/` and `tests/integration/`. Run them using:\n    24‚Üí\n    25‚Üí1. **In Godot**: Open the GUT addon panel and click \"Run All\"\n    26‚Üí2. **Command Line**: Use the CI workflow command:\n    27‚Üí   ```bash\n    28‚Üí   godot --headless -s addons/gut/gut_cmdln.gd -gdir=res://tests/unit,res://tests/integration -ginclude_subdirs -gexit\n    29‚Üí   ```\n    30‚Üí\n    31‚Üí### Writing Tests\n    32‚Üí\n    33‚Üí- **Every new feature MUST have tests** covering its core functionality\n    34‚Üí- **Every bug fix MUST have a regression test** preventing the bug from returning\n    35‚Üí- Use mock classes to test logic without requiring Godot scene tree\n    36‚Üí- Follow the existing test patterns in `tests/unit/`\n    37‚Üí\n    38‚Üí### Test Coverage Requirements\n    39‚Üí\n    40‚ÜíThe following areas have comprehensive test coverage:\n    41‚Üí\n    42‚Üí| Component | Test File | Coverage |\n    43‚Üí|-----------|-----------|----------|\n    44‚Üí| Audio Manager | `test_audio_manager.gd` | Sound playback, pools |\n    45‚Üí| Difficulty Manager | `test_difficulty_manager.gd` | Settings, levels |\n    46‚Üí| Enemy AI | `test_enemy.gd` | States, behaviors |\n    47‚Üí| GOAP Planner | `test_goap_planner.gd` | Planning, actions |\n    48‚Üí| Player | `test_player.gd` | Movement, shooting |\n    49‚Üí| Health Component | `test_health_component.gd` | Damage, healing |\n    50‚Üí| Vision Component | `test_vision_component.gd` | Detection, LOS |\n    51‚Üí| Cover Component | `test_cover_component.gd` | Cover finding |\n    52‚Üí| Grenade System | `test_grenade_base.gd` | Timer, throw physics |\n    53‚Üí| Status Effects | `test_status_effects_manager.gd` | Blindness, stun |\n    54‚Üí| Shrapnel | `test_shrapnel.gd` | Movement, ricochet |\n    55‚Üí\n    56‚Üí## Common Issues to Avoid\n    57‚Üí\n    58‚ÜíBased on historical issues, please pay special attention to these areas:\n    59‚Üí\n    60‚Üí### 1. Self-Damage Bugs (Issue #241)\n    61‚Üí**Problem**: Player bullets damaging the player\n    62‚Üí**Solution**: Always use `shooter_id` tracking for projectiles\n    63‚Üí```gdscript\n    64‚Üí# Good: Track who fired the projectile\n    65‚Üívar shooter_id: int = -1\n    66‚Üífunc _on_body_entered(body):\n    67‚Üí    if body.get_instance_id() == shooter_id:\n    68‚Üí        return  # Don't hit shooter\n    69‚Üí```\n    70‚Üí\n    71‚Üí### 2. Shotgun Reload Regressions (Issues #213, #229, #232, #243)\n    72‚Üí**Problem**: Shotgun reload functionality breaking after unrelated changes\n    73‚Üí**Solution**:\n    74‚Üí- Always run `test_magazine_inventory.gd` after weapon changes\n    75‚Üí- Test both Simple and Sequence reload modes\n    76‚Üí- Verify MMB + RMB interaction for shell loading\n    77‚Üí\n    78‚Üí### 3. Enemy Fire Rate Issues (Issue #228)\n    79‚Üí**Problem**: Enemies ignoring weapon fire rate limits\n    80‚Üí**Solution**: Use the weapon's `shoot_cooldown` property\n    81‚Üí```gdscript\n    82‚Üí# Good: Respect fire rate\n    83‚Üíif _shoot_timer >= weapon.shoot_cooldown:\n    84‚Üí    shoot()\n    85‚Üí    _shoot_timer = 0.0\n    86‚Üí```\n    87‚Üí\n    88‚Üí### 4. Feature Regression (Issue #232)\n    89‚Üí**Problem**: Fixed functionality breaking in later commits\n    90‚Üí**Solution**:\n    91‚Üí- Write regression tests for every bug fix\n    92‚Üí- Run full test suite before committing\n    93‚Üí- Check closed issues for functionality that must be preserved\n    94‚Üí\n    95‚Üí### 5. C# Build Failures (Issue #302, PR #275)\n    96‚Üí**Problem**: C# compilation errors cause \".NET assemblies not found\" in exports\n    97‚Üí**Solution**:\n    98‚Üí- Always run `dotnet build` locally before pushing C# changes\n    99‚Üí- Check CI workflow `csharp-validation.yml` for build status\n   100‚Üí- When modifying C# method signatures, search for all call sites\n   101‚Üí\n   102‚Üí```bash\n   103‚Üí# Always verify C# builds before pushing\n   104‚Üídotnet build\n   105‚Üí\n   106‚Üí# Search for method usages before changing signatures\n   107‚Üígrep -rn \"MethodName\" Scripts/\n   108‚Üí```\n   109‚Üí\n   110‚Üí### 6. C#/GDScript Interoperability Issues (Issue #302)\n   111‚Üí**Problem**: C# and GDScript components getting out of sync\n   112‚Üí**Solution**:\n   113‚Üí- Keep duplicate implementations intentional and documented\n   114‚Üí- Use `interop-check.yml` CI workflow to detect issues\n   115‚Üí- When calling C# from GDScript, use `node.call(\"MethodName\")`\n   116‚Üí\n   117‚Üí```gdscript\n   118‚Üí# Good: Safe cross-language call\n   119‚Üíif node.has_method(\"TakeDamage\"):\n   120‚Üí    node.call(\"TakeDamage\", damage_amount)\n   121‚Üí\n   122‚Üí# Bad: Assumes C# method exists\n   123‚Üínode.TakeDamage(damage_amount)  # May crash if C# failed to compile\n   124‚Üí```\n   125‚Üí\n   126‚Üí### 7. Enemy AI Breaking (Issues #104, #296, #157, PR #308)\n   127‚Üí**Problem**: Changes that completely break enemy behavior - enemies not moving, not taking damage, not detecting player\n   128‚Üí**Solution**:\n   129‚Üí- Never remove or rename critical methods: `_ready`, `_physics_process`, `on_hit`, `_on_death`, `_check_player_visibility`\n   130‚Üí- Preserve required state variables: `_is_alive`, `_current_health`, `_current_state`, `_player`, `_can_see_player`\n   131‚Üí- Maintain all AIState enum values (IDLE, COMBAT, SEEKING_COVER, etc.)\n   132‚Üí- Test enemy behavior after ANY changes to `scripts/objects/enemy.gd` or `scripts/ai/`\n   133‚Üí- Check `gameplay-validation.yml` CI workflow for issues\n   134‚Üí\n   135‚Üí```gdscript\n   136‚Üí# Critical: Always check _is_alive in state updates\n   137‚Üífunc _physics_process(delta: float) -> void:\n   138‚Üí    if not _is_alive:\n   139‚Üí        return\n   140‚Üí    # ... rest of behavior\n   141‚Üí\n   142‚Üí# Critical: _on_death() must emit signal for proper counting\n   143‚Üífunc _on_death() -> void:\n   144‚Üí    _is_alive = false\n   145‚Üí    died.emit()  # Required for enemy counting!\n   146‚Üí```\n   147‚Üí\n   148‚Üí### 8. Game Counter Breaking (Issue #127)\n   149‚Üí**Problem**: Enemy counters, ammo counters, or game state breaking after changes\n   150‚Üí**Solution**:\n   151‚Üí- Ensure `died` signal is emitted when enemy dies\n   152‚Üí- Verify signal connections in GameManager/autoloads\n   153‚Üí- Test that game properly ends after clearing all enemies\n   154‚Üí- Test ammo display updates correctly during combat\n   155‚Üí\n   156‚Üí```gdscript\n   157‚Üí# Critical: Always emit signals for counter updates\n   158‚Üífunc _on_death() -> void:\n   159‚Üí    _is_alive = false\n   160‚Üí    died.emit()  # GameManager listens for this!\n   161‚Üí    died_with_info.emit(is_ricochet, is_penetration)\n   162‚Üí\n   163‚Üífunc shoot() -> void:\n   164‚Üí    _current_ammo -= 1\n   165‚Üí    ammo_changed.emit(_current_ammo, _reserve_ammo)  # UI listens for this!\n   166‚Üí```\n   167‚Üí\n   168‚Üí### 9. Game Crashes (Issue #155)\n   169‚Üí**Problem**: Changes causing the game to crash\n   170‚Üí**Solution**:\n   171‚Üí- Always add null checks before accessing nodes or properties\n   172‚Üí- Verify PackedScene resources exist before instantiating\n   173‚Üí- Use `is_instance_valid()` before accessing potentially freed nodes\n   174‚Üí- Add error handling for file/resource loading\n   175‚Üí\n   176‚Üí```gdscript\n   177‚Üí# Good: Safe scene instantiation\n   178‚Üíif bullet_scene:\n   179‚Üí    var bullet = bullet_scene.instantiate()\n   180‚Üí    get_tree().root.add_child(bullet)\n   181‚Üí\n   182‚Üí# Good: Safe node access\n   183‚Üíif is_instance_valid(_player):\n   184‚Üí    var dir = global_position.direction_to(_player.global_position)\n   185‚Üí```\n   186‚Üí\n   187‚Üí## Pull Request Checklist\n   188‚Üí\n   189‚ÜíBefore submitting a PR, verify:\n   190‚Üí\n   191‚Üí- [ ] **Tests pass**: All unit and integration tests pass\n   192‚Üí- [ ] **New tests added**: For new features or bug fixes\n   193‚Üí- [ ] **CI passes**: All workflows pass (`test.yml`, `architecture-check.yml`, `csharp-validation.yml`, `interop-check.yml`, `gameplay-validation.yml`)\n   194‚Üí- [ ] **C# builds locally**: Run `dotnet build` for C# changes\n   195‚Üí- [ ] **No regressions**: Related functionality still works\n   196‚Üí- [ ] **Code follows style**: snake_case for GDScript, PascalCase for C#\n   197‚Üí- [ ] **Line limits**: Scripts under 5000 lines (target: 800)\n   198‚Üí- [ ] **class_name declared**: For components and AI states\n   199‚Üí\n   200‚Üí### Before Merging\n   201‚Üí\n   202‚Üí1. Verify all CI checks are green\n   203‚Üí2. Test the specific functionality affected\n   204‚Üí3. Test related functionality that might be impacted\n   205‚Üí4. Run the game and verify gameplay is not broken\n   206‚Üí\n   207‚Üí## Architecture Guidelines\n   208‚Üí\n   209‚Üí### File Organization\n   210‚Üí\n   211‚Üí```\n   212‚Üíscripts/\n   213‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ autoload/      # Singleton managers (AudioManager, GameManager, etc.)\n   214‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ai/            # AI systems (GOAP, states)\n   215‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ characters/    # Character scripts\n   216‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/    # Reusable components (HealthComponent, etc.)\n   217‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ effects/       # Visual effects\n   218‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ objects/       # Game objects (enemies, targets)\n   219‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ projectiles/   # Bullets, grenades, shrapnel\n   220‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ui/            # UI scripts\n   221‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ data/          # Data definitions (calibers, etc.)\n   222‚Üí```\n   223‚Üí\n   224‚Üí### Naming Conventions\n   225‚Üí\n   226‚Üí- **GDScript files**: `snake_case.gd`\n   227‚Üí- **C# files**: `PascalCase.cs`\n   228‚Üí- **Scenes**: `PascalCase.tscn`\n   229‚Üí- **Resources**: `snake_case.tres`\n   230‚Üí\n   231‚Üí### Component Pattern\n   232‚Üí\n   233‚ÜíUse reusable components for common functionality:\n   234‚Üí\n   235‚Üí```gdscript\n   236‚Üí# Good: Use component\n   237‚Üívar health_component := HealthComponent.new()\n   238‚Üíhealth_component.set_max_health(100)\n   239‚Üíadd_child(health_component)\n   240‚Üí\n   241‚Üí# Bad: Inline health logic\n   242‚Üívar health := 100\n   243‚Üífunc take_damage(amount):\n   244‚Üí    health -= amount\n   245‚Üí    # Duplicated health logic...\n   246‚Üí```\n   247‚Üí\n   248‚Üí### Autoload Access\n   249‚Üí\n   250‚ÜíAlways use null checks when accessing autoloads:\n   251‚Üí\n   252‚Üí```gdscript\n   253‚Üí# Good: Safe access\n   254‚Üívar audio_manager = get_node_or_null(\"/root/AudioManager\")\n   255‚Üíif audio_manager and audio_manager.has_method(\"play_sound\"):\n   256‚Üí    audio_manager.play_sound(\"res://sound.wav\")\n   257‚Üí\n   258‚Üí# Bad: Direct access\n   259‚ÜíAudioManager.play_sound(\"res://sound.wav\")  # Crashes if autoload missing\n   260‚Üí```\n   261‚Üí\n   262‚Üí## CI/CD Workflows\n   263‚Üí\n   264‚Üí### test.yml\n   265‚ÜíRuns GUT tests on push/PR to ensure functionality is preserved.\n   266‚Üí\n   267‚Üí### architecture-check.yml\n   268‚ÜíVerifies:\n   269‚Üí- Script line counts (max 5000 lines)\n   270‚Üí- class_name declarations in components\n   271‚Üí- Required folder structure\n   272‚Üí- snake_case naming convention\n   273‚Üí\n   274‚Üí### csharp-validation.yml\n   275‚Üí**Protection against C# build failures** (Issue #302):\n   276‚Üí- Validates C# code compiles with `dotnet build`\n   277‚Üí- Verifies assembly DLL is produced\n   278‚Üí- Catches errors that would cause \".NET assemblies not found\" in exports\n   279‚Üí\n   280‚Üí### interop-check.yml\n   281‚Üí**Protection against C#/GDScript integration issues** (Issue #302):\n   282‚Üí- Detects duplicate implementations across languages\n   283‚Üí- Checks scene signal connections to C# scripts\n   284‚Üí- Validates autoload references\n   285‚Üí- Warns about potential interoperability issues\n   286‚Üí\n   287‚Üí### gameplay-validation.yml\n   288‚Üí**Protection against critical gameplay breaking** (Issue #308):\n   289‚Üí- Validates enemy AI state machine integrity (required states, methods, variables)\n   290‚Üí- Detects dangerous code patterns (infinite loops, division by zero risks)\n   291‚Üí- Checks health component structure\n   292‚Üí- Validates counter/state reset signals\n   293‚Üí- Verifies scene-script references exist\n   294‚Üí- Warns when critical gameplay files are modified\n   295‚Üí\n   296‚ÜíThis workflow was added to prevent issues like:\n   297‚Üí- PR #104, #296: Enemy AI completely broken (not moving, not taking damage)\n   298‚Üí- PR #127: Game counters broken (enemy count, ammo count)\n   299‚Üí- PR #155: Game crashes\n   300‚Üí- PR #157: Enemy vision/detection broken\n   301‚Üí\n   302‚Üí## Getting Help\n   303‚Üí\n   304‚Üí- Check existing issues for similar problems\n   305‚Üí- Review closed issues for context on past fixes\n   306‚Üí- Ask questions in the issue tracker before making large changes\n   307‚Üí\n   308‚Üí## License\n   309‚Üí\n   310‚ÜíBy contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under the same license as the project (see LICENSE file).\n   311‚Üí\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.\n</system-reminder>\n"
